{"uri": "8219112571", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:03:01", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:03:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:02:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8941176533699036, "url": "https://www.news9live.com/world/george-clooney-says-joe-biden-not-the-man-he-was-in-2020-should-drop-out-of-us-presidential-race-2612285", "title": "George Clooney says Joe Biden not the man he was in 2020, should drop out of US Presidential race", "body": "Los Angeles: Actor George Clooney, a major Hollywood fundraiser for Democrats, said on Wednesday that President Joe Biden is no longer the same person who won the White House in 2020 and said he should drop his bid for re-election.\n\nClooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden in downtown Los Angeles in June, about two weeks before the 81-year-old president struggled through a debate with Republican former President Donald Trump.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'b F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added.\n\nA subsequent interview with ABC journalist George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney said.\n\nThe actor, who described himself as a lifelong Democrat, wrote: \"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\"\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nBiden said he had a \"bad night\" at the debate and has vowed to stay in the presidential race.\n\nClooney expressed admiration for Biden and said he considered him a friend.\n\n\"I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. {"uri": "8219122509", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:10:39", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:10:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:10:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8823529481887817, "url": "https://www.khaleejtimes.com/world/americas/this-is-about-age-close-ally-clooney-says-biden-must-exit", "title": "'This is about age': Close ally Clooney says Biden must exit", "body": "\"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him...But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time,\" says Clooney about Biden. -- AFP\n\nActor George Clooney, one of the Democratic Party's leading fundraisers, on Wednesday made an impassioned plea for US President Joe Biden to end his faltering reelection campaign.\n\nClooney, a member of the Hollywood elite that provides key support to the Democrats, joined a growing list of public figures calling for Biden, 81, to step aside after his debate performance against Donald Trump last month.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in The New York Times. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him...But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nA self-described \"lifelong Democrat\", Clooney last month co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser with Biden in Los Angeles, which also featured former president Barack Obama.\n\nThe Biden campaign said that the event brought in a record $28 million.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote, referencing a famous hot-mic clip from Biden's vice-presidency.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney said -- a direct challenge to Biden's claim that his poor debate showing was a one-off.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nHe said that with Biden at the top of the ticket, Democrats \"are not going to win in November\", will lose control of the Senate, and won't gain a majority in the House of Representatives.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nThe party should hear from contenders such as Vice-President Kamala Harris, Maryland Governor {"uri": "8219090860", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:46:38", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:46:38Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:45:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8745098114013672, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/politics/3012667-george-clooney-urges-president-biden-to-step-down-from-re-election-bid", "title": "George Clooney Urges President Biden to Step Down from Re-Election Bid | Politics", "body": "Actor George Clooney, a prominent Democratic fundraiser, advises President Joe Biden to drop his re-election bid, stating that Biden is no longer the same leader who won in 2020. Clooney emphasizes the widespread agreement among Democratic leaders and expresses concern about the party's chances in upcoming elections.\n\nActor George Clooney, a major Hollywood fundraiser for Democrats, said on Wednesday that President Joe Biden is no longer the same person who won the White House in 2020 and urged him to drop his bid for re-election.\n\nClooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden in downtown Los Angeles in June, about two weeks before the 81-year-old president struggled through a debate with Republican former President Donald Trump. \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'b F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in The New York Times. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added. A subsequent interview with ABC journalist George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney said.\n\nThe actor, who described himself as a lifelong Democrat, wrote: \"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\" \"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator, congress member, and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nBiden acknowledged having a \"bad night\" at the debate and has vowed to stay in the presidential race. Clooney expressed admiration for Biden and said he considered him a friend.\n\n\"I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney said. \"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": {"uri": "8219222508", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:32:35", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:32:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T18:32:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8705882430076599, "url": "https://cyprus-mail.com/2024/07/10/george-clooney-says-biden-not-the-man-he-was-in-2020-should-drop-out/", "title": "George Clooney says Biden not the man he was in 2020, should drop out", "body": "Actor George Clooney, a major Hollywood fundraiser for Democrats, said on Wednesday that President Joe Biden is no longer the same person who won the White House in 2020 and said he should drop his bid for re-election.\n\nClooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden in Los Angeles in June, about two weeks before the 81-year-old president struggled through a debate with Republican former President Donald Trump, his rival in the Nov 5 election.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added.\n\nA subsequent Biden interview with ABC journalist George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney said.\n\nOften described as an \"ATM for Democrats,\" Hollywood has traditionally been a significant source of donations for the party. Clooney's event, hosted with actor Julia Roberts, raised more than $30 million in what the Biden campaign said was the largest Democratic fundraiser in history.\n\nAfter Biden's debate performance, several Hollywood donors called on the president to end his campaign.\n\nNetflix co-founder Reed Hastings, Disney heir Abigail Disney and filmmaker Rob Reiner are among those who have said Biden should step aside. Screenwriter Damon Lindelof proposed that his Hollywood colleagues stop writing checks to Democrats until Biden withdraws.\n\nIn Washington, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, a longtime Biden ally, said on Wednesday the president must decide quickly if he will stay in the race.\n\nClooney, who described himself as a lifelong Democrat, wrote: \"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\"\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nAsked to respond, Biden's campaign referred to a letter the president sent Democrats in Congress that said he was \"firmly committed\" to his candidacy and beating Trump. Biden has said he had a \"bad night\" at the debate and vowed to stay in the race.\n\nClooney said leading Democrats and candidates who risk losing in November should ask Biden to drop his campaign.\n\nThe actor suggested that the party decide on a new nominee at its August convention and offered the names of several possible contenders including Vice President Kamala Harris and several state governors.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others,\" Clooney said.\n\nHe also expressed admiration for Biden and said he considered him a friend.\n\n\"I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney said.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"", "source": {"uri": "cyprus-mail.com", "dataType": {"uri": "8219005931", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "15:46:03", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T15:46:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:45:37Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8666666746139526, "url": "https://www.mediaite.com/biden/oceans-a-leavin-george-clooney-confirms-bidens-decline-in-devastating-call-for-him-to-drop-out/", "title": "Ocean's A-Leavin': George Clooney Confirms Biden's Decline in 'Devastating' Call For Him to Drop Out", "body": "Actor and longtime Democratic fundraiser George Clooney penned a New York Times op-ed calling on President Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 presidential race.\n\nWeeks prior to the release of Clooney's piece in The Times, the Hollywood celebrity hosted a major fundraiser for the presumptive Democratic nominee that raked in $28 million. However, following Biden's performance in the June 27 debate against Donald Trump, Clooney has changed his tune on the president.\n\nDemocratic strategists, pundits, and lawmakers in recent days have called on Biden to bow out of the race due to his poor showing at the debate. Biden had difficulty answering some questions and spoke with a raspy voice.\n\nClooney noted in his Wednesday opinion piece that he has supported the last three Democratic presidential nominees and led some of the biggest fundraisers in the party's history. He expressed his love for Biden, adding that he considers the president a \"close friend.\"\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney wrote. He went on to claim that Biden did not appear mentally fit when they met at the fundraiser three weeks ago, writing, \"he wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020.\"\n\nClooney continued, \"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLater in the op-ed, Clooney cited Biden's recent interview with George Stephanopoulos as reasoning behind his demands calling for the president to step out of the race.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nClooney then claimed that \"every senator and congress member and governor\" that he has spoken to in private believes Democrats \"are not going to win in November with this president.\"\n\nHe concludes, \"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in {"uri": "2024-07-417736534", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:10:31", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:10:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T12:43:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8627451062202454, "url": "https://www.usnews.com/news/top-news/articles/2024-07-10/george-clooney-says-biden-not-the-man-he-was-in-2020-should-drop-out", "title": "George Clooney Says Biden Not the Man He Was in 2020, Should Drop Out", "body": "LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Actor George Clooney, a major Hollywood fundraiser for Democrats, said on Wednesday that President Joe Biden is no longer the same person who won the White House in 2020 and said he should drop his bid for re-election.\n\nClooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden in downtown Los Angeles in June, about two weeks before the 81-year-old president struggled through a debate with Republican former President Donald Trump.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'b F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added.\n\nA subsequent interview with ABC journalist George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney said.\n\nThe actor, who described himself as a lifelong Democrat, wrote: \"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\"\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nBiden said he had a \"bad night\" at the debate and has vowed to stay in the presidential race.\n\nClooney expressed admiration for Biden and said he considered him a friend.\n\n\"I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney said.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\n(Reporting by Lisa Richwine; Editing by Heather {"uri": "8219304298", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:50:28", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:50:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:49:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8588235378265381, "url": "https://globalnews.ca/news/10614672/george-clooney-joe-biden-drop-out-presidential-race/", "title": "George Clooney calls for Joe Biden to drop out of presidential race - National | Globalnews.ca", "body": "In a scathing op-ed published in The New York Times on Wednesday, Clooney said the 81-year-old president is too old to run for re-election.\n\nDespite calling himself a \"lifelong Democrat,\" Clooney said Biden is no longer the fierce leader he was during previous elections or earlier in his career as a senator.\n\nClooney, 63, said current Democratic senators, congress members and governors have told him in private conversations that they are concerned about Biden, regardless of what they are saying publicly.\n\nClooney is a high-profile donor and supporter of the American Democratic Party. In the past, he has hosted massive fundraising events for several nominees, including for Biden during the 2020 election.\n\nIn June, Clooney hosted the single largest fundraiser supporting any Democratic candidate in history, which advocated for Biden's re-election.\n\nNow, Clooney has changed his mind.\n\nHis call for Biden to step down as Democratic nominee comes after Biden's poor performance at a June debate against Trump.\n\nThough Biden's performance sparked concern -- and in some cases, outrage -- among Democratic supporters, the president this month vowed to stay in the race.\n\nStill, some of those in his own party have refused to outright endorse Biden for re-election, including Speaker Emerita Nancy Pelosi, who on Wednesday said advisors are waiting for the president to officially decide whether or not to stay in the race.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe,\" Clooney said of Biden's fumbling debate performance and the president's subsequent reasoning for it. \"But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw.\"\n\nAmong his criticism, the actor made sure to praise Biden's political accomplishments.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\nClooney said the one battle Biden cannot win, however, \"is the fight against time.\"\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010, He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020,\" Clooney lamented. \"He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney said his concerns over Biden are about his age, and \"nothing more.\"\n\nWith Biden as nominee, Clooney predicted a Republican president and Democratic losses in both the House and the Senate.\n\nHe encouraged members of the Democratic Party to hear from other party members who could potentially be put on the ballot, namely Wes Moore, Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer, as well as others.\n\n\"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020,\" Clooney concluded. \"We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nThough Clooney is the highest-profile person to publicly insist Biden end his campaign, he is not the only one. Already, major Democratic donors Abigail Disney and Stewart Bainum Jr., as well as New York Democrat Pat Ryan and New Jersey Democrat Mikie Sherrill among others, have called for Biden to drop out of I consider him a friend, and I believe in him... But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time\n\nNEW YORK: Actor George Clooney, one of the Democratic Party's leading fundraisers, on Wednesday made an emotional and heartfelt plea for President Joe Biden to end his faltering reelection campaign.\n\nClooney -- a member of the Hollywood elite that provides key support to the Democrats -- joined a growing list of public figures calling for Biden, 81, to step aside after his terrible debate performance against Donald Trump last month.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him... But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nA self-described \"lifelong Democrat,\" Clooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser with Biden in Los Angeles only last month featuring former president Barack Obama.\n\nThe Biden campaign said that the event brought in a record $28 million.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote, referencing a famous hot-mic clip from Biden's vice presidency.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney said -- a direct challenge to Biden's claim that his poor debate showing was a one-off.\n\n\"The dam has broken\" on Democratic lawmakers publicly calling for Biden to withdraw, Clooney said, asking for more to come forward.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\nThe Oscar-winner brushed aside worries that Biden's exit would create chaos four months before an election in which the Democrats hope to keep Trump from power, and did not endorse a replacement candidate.\n\nThe party should hear from contenders such as Vice President Kamala Harris, Maryland Clooney, who co-hosted a huge Hollywood fundraiser for Biden just last month that raised a record $28 million, has seemingly changed his tune after Biden's disastrous performance in the first presidential debate against Donald Trump.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president,\" Clooney wrote. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced. \"\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time,\" he continued, \"None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney noted that Democrats have been \"all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign\" when it comes to Biden's aging. The Oscar winner said that Biden's post-debate interview with ABC News and George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced\" that Biden should not be the Democratic nominee.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more,\" Clooney wrote. \"But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\n\"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024,\" Clooney concluded.\n\nClooney is one of many Hollywood names who have now spoken out against Biden remaining the Democratic nominee, including Rob Reiner, Stephen King and Michael Moore. The latter said on a recent episode of his \"Rumble\" podcast that Biden's disastrous debate was \"the cruelest form of elder abuse I've ever been forced to watch.\"\n\n\"This is not about whether he's fit to serve another four years,\" Moore added about Biden. \"After what we saw on debate night, this is about whether he should serve another four days in the toughest job in the world. That's the question we should be asking. Leave Mr. Biden alone! Let him rest. Let him go home. He has done his job. Let him have his dignity. Please. Do him this favor.\"\n\nDuring his interview with ABC News following the debate, Biden pushed back against his critics and stressed he currently has no intention of dropping out of the presidential {"uri": "8219227242", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:36:43", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:36:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T18:36:18Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8549019694328308, "url": "https://www.wccbcharlotte.com/2024/07/10/george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/", "title": "George Clooney, A High-Profile Biden Supporter And Fundraiser, Asks President To Leave Race - WCCB Charlotte's CW", "body": "Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nFILE - President Joe Biden shakes hands with actor, director and producer George Clooney during the Kennedy Center honorees reception at the White House in Washington, Dec. 4, 2022. Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race. Clooney says in a New York Times opinion piece Wednesday that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee. (AP Photo/Manuel Balce Ceneta)\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterization of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\nFacebookTwitterPinterestLinkedin", "source": {"uri": "wccbcharlotte.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "WCCB Charlotte's CW"}, "authors": [{"uri": "jack_hale@wccbcharlotte.com", "name": "Jack Hale", "type": "author", "isAgency": false}], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Clooney", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "George Clooney"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden", "type": "person", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Joe Biden"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)", "type": "org", "score": 5, "label": {"eng": "Democratic Party (United States)"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Op-ed", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "Op-ed"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "United States Congress"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_York_Times", "type": "wiki", "score": 4, "label": {"eng": "The New York Times"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump_2020_presidential_campaign", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "Donald Trump 2020 presidential campaign"}}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy_Center_for_the_Performing_Arts", "type": "wiki", "score": 3, "label": {"eng": "John F. {"uri": "8219141770", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:25:18", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:25:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:25:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8509804010391235, "url": "https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/us-news/presidential-election/2024/07/10/668eb9f822601d186b8b4590.html", "title": "George Clooney urges Biden to step down as 2024 Democratic nominee", "body": "Presidential Election. Top Campaign official has no hopes for President Joe Biden: \"It's only a matter of time'\n\nIn a recent op-ed for The New York Times, George Clooney joins the chorus of Hollywood voices urging Joe Biden to step down as the 2024 Democratic nominee for president. Clooney, who co-hosted a major Hollywood fundraiser for Biden in June that raised a record $28 million, seems to have reconsidered his stance after Biden's poor performance in the first presidential debate against Donald Trump.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president,\" Clooney wrote. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\nClooney added: \"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe actor emphasized that Democrats are so scared of a second Trump term that they are ignoring signs of Biden's aging. He noted that Biden's post-debate interview with ABC News and George Stephanopoulos further convinced him that Biden should not be the Democratic nominee.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more,\" Clooney wrote. \"But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney concluded, \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nClooney is among several Hollywood figures, including Rob Reiner, Stephen King, and Michael Moore, who have spoken out against Biden remaining the Democratic nominee. Moore recently said on his \"Rumble\" podcast that Biden's debate performance was \"the cruelest form of elder abuse I've ever been forced to watch.\"\n\nIn an interview with ABC News following the debate, Biden pushed back against his critics and insisted he has no plans to drop out of the presidential race.", "source": {"uri": "marca.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "MARCA"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "2024-07-417718792", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:52:16", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:52:16Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:23:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8509804010391235, "url": "https://tribtown.com/2024/07/10/actor-george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race", "body": "FILE - President Joe Biden shakes hands with actor, director and producer George Clooney during the Kennedy Center honorees reception at the White House in Washington, Dec. 4, 2022. Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race. Clooney says in a New [...]\n\nMovie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterization of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\n___\n\nKinnard reported from Chapin, South Carolina. {"uri": "2024-07-417803524", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:28:54", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:28:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:48:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8509804010391235, "url": "https://www.ibtimes.com.au/this-about-age-close-ally-clooney-says-biden-must-exit-1849417", "title": "'This Is About Age': Close Ally Clooney Says Biden Must Exit", "body": "Actor George Clooney, one of the Democratic Party's leading fundraisers, on Wednesday made an impassioned plea for US President Joe Biden to end his faltering reelection campaign.\n\nClooney -- a member of the Hollywood elite that provides key support to the Democrats -- joined a growing list of public figures calling for Biden, 81, to step aside after his faltering debate performance against Donald Trump last month.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him... But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nWith Biden at the top of the ticket, the Oscar-winner said, Democrats \"are not going to win in November,\" will lose control of the Senate, and won't gain a majority in the House of Representatives.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and Congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\nClooney's call was quickly backed by Hollywood director Rob Reiner, a voiceful Democrat who also demanded days ago that Biden bow out.\n\n\"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying... Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside,\" wrote Reiner on X.\n\nA self-described \"lifelong Democrat,\" the 63-year-old Clooney last month co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser with Biden in Los Angeles, which also featured former president Barack Obama.\n\nThe Biden campaign said the event brought in a record $28 million.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote, referencing a famous hot-mic clip from Biden's vice presidency.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney said -- a direct challenge to Biden's claim that his poor debate showing was a one-off.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nActor Michael Douglas, who also hosted a Hollywood fundraiser for Biden in April, said Clooney had a \"valid point\" when asked about the editorial during an appearance Wednesday on \"The View\" TV chat show.\n\nDouglas did not call for Biden to step aside, but said he was \"deeply, deeply concerned.\"\n\n\"I adore the guy... and this just happens to be one of these elections that is just so crucial,\" he said, adding \"I don't worry necessarily today or tomorrow, but a year down the line, I worry.\"\n\nClooney joined critics who have likened Democrats' hesitancy to jettison Biden to the Republican Party's unshakeable loyalty to Trump.\n\n\"We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power... to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" he said.\n\nBut with several lawmakers already openly calling for Biden to step aside and more expressing worries, \"the dam has broken,\" Clooney said, asking more come forward.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\nClooney brushed aside worries that Biden's exit would create chaos four months before an election in which the Democrats hope to keep Trump from power, and did not endorse a replacement candidate.\n\n\"We Democrats have a very exciting bench. We don't anoint leaders or fall sway to a cult of personality; we vote for a president,\" he said.\n\nThe party should hear from contenders such as Vice President Kamala Harris, Maryland Governor Wes Moore and others, Clooney wrote, \"then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nClooney did not say whether he would withhold funding until Biden leaves, as Abigail Disney -- an heiress to the Disney media fortune -- did last week, along with several other wealthy donors.", "source": {"uri": "ibtimes.com.au", "dataType": "news", "title": "International {"uri": "8219045790", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:12:52", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:12:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:12:15Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8470588326454163, "url": "https://www.nbcmiami.com/news/national-international/george-clooney-calls-on-biden-to-drop-out-of-the-race/3357826/", "title": "George Clooney calls on Biden to drop out of the race", "body": "Clooney said Biden has clearly lost a step and his struggles were evident during a fundraiser.\n\nHollywood superstar George Clooney said Wednesday that it was time for President Joe Biden to drop out of the presidential race, after Biden's disastrous debate performance and a fundraiser the actor and filmmaker co-hosted for Biden in June.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in a New York Times op-ed.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe June event was a star studded fundraiser in Los Angeles featuring former President Barack Obama, actress Julia Roberts and comedian Jimmy Kimmel. The evening raised over $30 million for Biden and his larger political operation, according to NBC News.\n\nBiden's fumbling debate performance opposite former President Donald Trump was on June 27, nearly two weeks after the fundraiser in Los Angeles.\n\nClooney's op-ed was published on Wednesday, nearly two weeks after the disastrous debate, and the same day former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif. refused to explicitly endorse Biden as the nominee.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" wrote Clooney. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nReached for comment, a Biden campaign spokesman pointed CNBC to the president's comments insisting that he will stay in the race.\n\nAs Biden digs in, the delicate question of how to convince him to abandon the race is vexing Democrats on Capitol Hill. Clooney implored Democratic leaders like Pelosi to ask the president to stand down.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nClooney also wrote that the president's performances after the late June debate hadn't been good enough to quell concerns, including Biden's recent interview on ABC.\n\n\"The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" wrote Clooney.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nClooney was also careful to praise the president, who has racked up a string of legislative accomplishments in office. \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nBut for the Biden campaign, Clooney represents only the latest wealthy Democratic party contributor to call on the president to step down.\n\nAbigail Disney, Stewart Bainum Jr. and Reed Hastings are among the party's donors who have already publicly said the president should pass the baton to another candidate.\n\nDisney and philanthropist and investor Gideon Stein both told CNBC they were done helping Democrats raise money, unless Biden announces that he won't run for reelection.", "source": {"uri": "nbcmiami.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NBC {"uri": "8219037555", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:07:25", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:07:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:06:46Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8470588326454163, "url": "https://gazette.com/ap/national/actor-george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/article_44f09f28-ba0c-5f8a-8008-063444c02dfc.html", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race", "body": "FILE - Actor George Clooney speaks to the media following a meeting at the White House in Washington, Feb. 23, 2009. Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race. Clooney says in a New York Times opinion piece Wednesday that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\nMovie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nFeatured Local Savings\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\nKinnard reported from Chapin, South Carolina. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak {"uri": "8219049928", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:17:54", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:17:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:15:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.843137264251709, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/george-clooney-calls-biden-drop-160733783.html", "title": "George Clooney Calls On Biden To Drop Out: 'We Are Not Going To Win In November'", "body": "Actor George Clooney, a stalwart Democratic fundraiser who most recently helped raise a whopping $30 million for President Joe Biden, is now calling on him to end his campaign for reelection due to his advancing age.\n\nClooney went out of his way to stress his feelings about the president in his opinion piece for The New York Times, which was titled, \"I Love Joe Biden. But We Need A New Nominee.\"\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals.\"\n\nBut Biden, like everyone, cannot roll back the clock, Clooney said.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nBiden's poor performance at last month's debate with former President Donald Trump still has Democrats scrambling two weeks afterward as party leadership considers whether to support an alternative candidate.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney went on. Biden's team had said that a cold had made the president's voice shallow and raspy at the debate.\n\nDemocrats, the actor said, are in a white-knuckle position every time the president -- \"who we respect\" -- is positioned in front of a camera or microphone, afraid of another bad slip-up.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" Clooney said. \"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney argued that it was \"disingenuous\" to say the matter of Biden's nomination is settled when \"we just received new and upsetting information,\" and that a new candidate would \"in all likelihood\" be able to make use of the Biden campaign's millions in funds. Clooney encouraged Democrats like Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer and California Gov. Gavin Newsom to throw their hats into the ring and partake in debates where they agree not to attack one another.\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? {"uri": "8219068501", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:29:06", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:29:06Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:28:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.843137264251709, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-13620657/George-Clooney-urges-Biden-end-campaign.html", "title": "'This is about age': Close ally Clooney says Biden must exit", "body": "Clooney said Biden had declined in recent years and that he cannot win the 'fight against time'\n\nActor George Clooney, one of the Democratic Party's leading fundraisers, on Wednesday made an impassioned plea for US President Joe Biden to end his faltering reelection campaign.\n\nClooney -- a member of the Hollywood elite that provides key support to the Democrats -- joined a growing list of public figures calling for Biden, 81, to step aside after his debate performance against Donald Trump last month.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him... But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nA self-described \"lifelong Democrat,\" Clooney last month co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser with Biden in Los Angeles, which also featured former president Barack Obama.\n\nThe Biden campaign said that the event brought in a record $28 million.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote, referencing a famous hot-mic clip from Biden's vice presidency.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney said -- a direct challenge to Biden's claim that his poor debate showing was a one-off.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nHe said that with Biden at the top of the ticket, Democrats \"are not going to win in November,\" will lose control of the Senate, and won't gain a majority in the House of Representatives.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\n- Not a 'cult of personality' -\n\nHe also joined critics who have likened Democrats' hesitancy to jettison Biden to the Republican Party's unshakeable loyalty to Trump.\n\n\"We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power... to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" he said.\n\nClooney co-hosted a June fundraiser in Hollywood featuring Biden and ex-president Barack Obama\n\nBut with several lawmakers already openly calling for Biden to step aside and more expressing worries, \"the dam has broken,\" Clooney said, asking more come forward.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\nThe Oscar-winner brushed aside worries that Biden's exit would create chaos four months before an election in which the Democrats hope to keep Trump from power, and did not endorse a replacement candidate.\n\n\"We Democrats have a very exciting bench. We don't anoint leaders or fall sway to a cult of personality; we vote for a president,\" he said.\n\nThe party should hear from contenders such as Vice President Kamala Harris, Maryland Governor Wes {"uri": "2024-07-417669331", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:04:23", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:04:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:48:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.843137264251709, "url": "https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/4763815-george-clooney-biden-drop-out-new-york-times/", "title": "Top fundraiser George Clooney abandons Biden: 'The dam has broken'", "body": "George Clooney, who just last month hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Joe Biden's campaign, is reversing course, saying Democrats are \"not going to win in November with this president.\"\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" the \"Ticket to Paradise\" star, one of Hollywood's most prominent Democratic supporters, said in an editorial published Wednesday in The New York Times.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can,\" Clooney wrote of the 81-year-old commander in chief.\n\nLast month, Clooney joined former President Obama and actor Julia Roberts for a buzzy and record-breaking Los Angeles fundraiser for Biden's campaign. The event raised $30 million.\n\nBut in his New York Times essay, Clooney acknowledged that he observed a difference in Biden at the glitzy fundraiser.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nBiden's shaky performance, which critics and some allies described as \"disastrous,\" in his debate last month against former President Trump in Atlanta renewed concerns about his age and viability as the Democratic presidential candidate. Several House Democrats have called on Biden to exit the White House race -- an idea that he's repeatedly rejected.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" Clooney, 63, said.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed,\" the Academy Award winner said.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" he said, citing \"the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor\" that he said he had spoken with privately.\n\n\"We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power, and all of the traits that made it so formidable with Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush, to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" Clooney said.\n\n\"But the dam has broken,\" he said.\n\n\"We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\"\n\nReached for comment, a Biden campaign official pointed ITK to the president's prior comments vowing to continue his reelection bid.\n\n\"I'm the sitting President of the United States. I'm the nominee of the Democratic party. I'm staying in the race,\" Biden said last week.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" Clooney said.\n\nThe entertainer argued that top Democrats, including Sen. Chuck Schumer (N.Y.) and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (N.Y.) and former Speaker Nancy Pelosi (Calif.) \"need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would,\" Clooney said.\n\nBiden, Clooney wrote, \"is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020.\"", "source": {"uri": "thehill.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Hill"}, "authors": [{"uri": He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe June event was a star studded fundraiser in Los Angeles featuring former President Barack Obama, actress Julia Roberts and comedian Jimmy Kimmel. The evening raised over $30 million for Biden and his larger political operation, according to NBC News.\n\nBiden's fumbling debate performance opposite former President Donald Trump was on June 27, nearly two weeks after the fundraiser in Los Angeles.\n\nClooney's op-ed was published on Wednesday, nearly two weeks after the disastrous debate, and the same day former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif. refused to explicitly endorse Biden as the nominee.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" wrote Clooney. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nReached for comment, a Biden campaign spokesman pointed CNBC to the president's comments insisting that he will stay in the race.\n\nAs Biden digs in, the delicate question of how to convince him to abandon the race is vexing Democrats on Capitol Hill. Clooney implored Democratic leaders like Pelosi to ask the president to stand down.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nClooney also wrote that the president's performances after the late June debate hadn't been good enough to quell concerns, including Biden's recent interview on ABC.\n\n\"The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" wrote Clooney.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nClooney was also careful to praise the president, who has racked up a string of legislative accomplishments in office. \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nBut for the Biden campaign, Clooney represents only the latest wealthy Democratic party contributor to call on the president to step down.\n\nAbigail Disney, Stewart Bainum Jr. and Reed Hastings are among the party's donors who have already publicly said the president should pass the baton to another candidate.\n\nDisney and philanthropist and investor {"uri": "2024-07-417693831", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:25:50", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:25:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:35:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.independent.ie/entertainment/movies/biden-supporter-george-clooney-asks-president-to-leave-race/a227995419.html", "title": "Biden supporter George Clooney asks president to leave race", "body": "Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney has added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Mr Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney.\n\nHe has hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Mr Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favour, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Governors Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Mr Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record 30 million dollars-plus for Mr Biden, in hopes of energising would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in US history.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Mr Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives\".\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nMr Biden has refused to end his re-election bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.", "source": {"uri": "independent.ie", "dataType": "news", "title": "Irish Independent"}, "authors": [], "concepts": {"uri": "8219331116", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "20:18:53", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T20:18:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T20:15:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.eagletribune.com/region/actor-george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/article_8404bdb4-6538-5c10-a1ee-e633e76b0e9c.html", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race", "body": "FILE - Actor George Clooney speaks to the media following a meeting at the White House in Washington, Feb. 23, 2009. Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race. Clooney says in a New York Times opinion piece Wednesday that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\nMovie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterization of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\nKinnard reported from Chapin, South Carolina. She can be reached at http://twitter.com/MegKinnardAP\n\nAamer Madhani contributed to this story from Washington.", "source": {"uri": "eagletribune.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Eagle-Tribune"}, {"uri": "8219337996", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "20:23:37", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T20:23:37Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T20:22:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8313725590705872, "url": "https://www.castanet.net/news/Entertainment/496517/Actor-George-Clooney-a-high-profile-Biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race - Entertainment News", "body": "Photo: The Canadian Press FILE - President Joe Biden shakes hands with actor, director and producer George Clooney during the Kennedy Center honorees reception at the White House in Washington, Dec. 4, 2022. Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race. Clooney says in a New York Times opinion piece Wednesday that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee. (AP Photo/Manuel Balce Ceneta)\n\nMovie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterization of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nAsked for comment on Clooney's essay, Biden's campaign pointed to the president's letter to congressional Democrats earlier in the week vowing to stay in the race.\n\nHis team also disputed the actor's representation of Biden's demeanor during the Los Angeles fundraiser, with campaign officials who attended the event pointing out that the president stayed for more than three hours at the event, despite just having returned from Europe.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.", "source": {"uri": "castanet.net", "dataType": "news", "title": "Castanet"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri":
