{"uri": "2024-07-417723901", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:57:19", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:57:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:44:26Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7960784435272217, "url": "https://kion546.com/politics/cnn-us-politics/2024/07/10/george-clooney-says-democrats-need-a-new-nominee-just-weeks-after-he-hosted-a-major-fundraiser-for-biden/", "title": "George Clooney says Democrats need a new nominee just weeks after he hosted a major fundraiser for Biden - KION546", "body": "Washington (CNN) -- The actor George Clooney, who had been among President Joe Biden's biggest supporters and donors in Hollywood, called on Biden to bow out of the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after he hosted a major fundraiser for his reelection campaign.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in a New York Times opinion piece. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him.\"\n\nBut, Clooney added, the Biden he saw during the June 15 fundraiser, which also included former President Barack Obama, \"was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020.\"\n\n\"He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney added, referencing Biden's faltering and disastrous performance at the June 27 presidential debate on CNN.\n\nThat statement was a stunning assessment of Biden's current state from someone who has interacted with the president privately -- that the way the president presented himself during that debate, which the White House and Biden campaign have alternatively blamed on a cold and a tiring travel schedule, was not an aberration.\n\nAsked for comment Wednesday, Biden's campaign pointed toward the letter the president wrote to members of Congress on Monday indicating he would remain in the race.\n\nClooney's opinion piece represents the biggest defection against Biden in Hollywood, which the party has long relied on for big-named support and money. It comes as a handful of Democrats in Congress have also publicly demanded Biden step aside due to persistent concerns about his age and mental acuity.\n\nThe fundraiser that Clooney headlined raised $28 million for Biden's reelection campaign, the most for the Democratic Party from a single event in history.\n\nIn the opinion piece, Clooney called on key Democrats -- naming Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries and former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi -- to ask Biden to \"voluntarily step aside.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" Clooney warned, adding that the lawmakers he has spoken with privately shared this view.\n\nHe said the country deserves to hear from other politicians who are seen as potential replacements for Biden on the ticket, including Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, Vice President Kamala Harris, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear and Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker.\n\nSaying \"the dam has broken,\" Clooney wrote \"we can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\"\n\nAlthough Clooney has been one of Biden's biggest bundlers, fractures in their relationship began showing before the high-profile fundraiser he hosted for the president. Clooney's wife, Amal Clooney, is an international human rights lawyer who was among the group of legal experts who asked the International Criminal Court to seek arrest warrants for both Israeli and Hamas leaders due to the continued war between those two factions.\n\nBiden forcefully criticized the ICC's efforts because of the implication of an equivalence between Israel and Hamas.\n\nClooney's opinion piece comes amid the most crucial week of Biden's reelection campaign, as cracks in the coalition of Democratic support behind Biden continued to grow. At least eight members of Congress from his own party have publicly asked Biden to step down from the ticket.\n\nClooney isn't the only prominent Hollywood Democrat who has asked Biden to step down. Rob Reiner, a Biden surrogate who attended a fundraiser alongside Harris after the debate, also called for the president to step aside.\n\n\"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying. We love and respect Joe Biden. We acknowledge all he has done for our country. But Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside,\" Reiner said in a post to social media platform X Wednesday in which he linked to Clooney's op-ed.\n\nReiner began his calls on Biden to step down earlier this week.\n\n\"It's time to stop [expletive] around. If the Convicted Felon wins, we lose our Democracy. Joe Biden has effectively served US with honor, decency, and dignity. It's time for Joe Biden to step down,\" he wrote Sunday.\n\nBiden is participating in high-stakes meetings with NATO allies on Wednesday and will hold a solo news conference -- his first since the debate -- on Thursday.\n\nCNN's Betsy Klein contributed to this report.\n\nThe-CNN-Wire\n\n\u2122 & \u00a9 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. {"uri": "8219185411", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:00:54", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:00:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T18:00:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.thecut.com/article/george-clooney-joe-biden-op-ed.html", "title": "George Clooney Calls for Joe Biden to Step Down", "body": "In his essay, the actor calls himself a \"lifelong Democrat\" who is \"proud of what my party represents and what it stands for.\" Clooney reiterates the work he's done for the party -- hosting record-breaking Hollywood fundraiser after record-breaking Hollywood fundraiser, including one in June -- before dropping the hammer.\n\n\"The one battle [Biden] cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can,\" Clooney wrote. \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney did not mince words about his belief that Biden cannot win a second term. \"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\" I would love to know which governors George Clooney is speaking to in private, but I guess that's not really the point.\n\nUnmentioned in his op-ed was Clooney's recent tiff with the Biden administration. His wife, Amal Clooney, was under threat of being sanctioned by the U.S. as an adviser to the International Criminal Court's investigation into possible war crimes committed by both Israel and Hamas. The White House eventually stepped back from the possibility of sanctioning the ICC, but Clooney still lodged a complaint. The actor reportedly called top Biden aide Steve Ricchetti to criticize Biden's use of the word \"outrageous\" in describing his wife's work. It seems as though the Biden team made it up to Clooney, though, as the actor co-hosted a fundraiser last month that raised $28 million for the president's war chest. Per the Washington Post, the Biden campaign \"disputed the notion that there were serious worries about Clooney dropping out of the fundraiser.\"\n\nDespite his personal feelings about Biden, Clooney made sure to reiterate his admiration for the president multiple times in his op-ed. He also threw out a few names of people he'd like to see on the Democratic ticket, including governors Wes Moore, Gavin Newsom, Andy Beshear, Gretchen Whitmer, and J.B. Pritzker. (He really is hanging out with governors in private, huh?)\n\nClooney ended his essay with a Sorkinesque plea: \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. {"uri": "2024-07-417780341", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:59:55", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:59:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:24:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.kulr8.com/news/national/this-is-about-age-close-ally-clooney-says-biden-must-exit/article_b99400ca-3457-5a78-a8e9-c21dfac06165.html", "title": "'This is about age': Close ally Clooney says Biden must exit", "body": "Clooney co-hosted a June fundraiser in Hollywood featuring Biden and ex-president Barack Obama\n\nActor George Clooney, one of the Democratic Party's leading fundraisers, on Wednesday made an impassioned plea for US President Joe Biden to end his faltering reelection campaign.\n\nClooney -- a member of the Hollywood elite that provides key support to the Democrats -- joined a growing list of public figures calling for Biden, 81, to step aside after his debate performance against Donald Trump last month.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in the New York Times. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him... But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nA self-described \"lifelong Democrat,\" Clooney last month co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser with Biden in Los Angeles, which also featured former president Barack Obama.\n\nThe Biden campaign said that the event brought in a record $28 million.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote, referencing a famous hot-mic clip from Biden's vice presidency.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney said -- a direct challenge to Biden's claim that his poor debate showing was a one-off.\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nHe said that with Biden at the top of the ticket, Democrats \"are not going to win in November,\" will lose control of the Senate, and won't gain a majority in the House of Representatives.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney wrote.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\n- Not a 'cult of personality' -\n\nHe also joined critics who have likened Democrats' hesitancy to jettison Biden to the Republican Party's unshakeable loyalty to Trump.\n\n\"We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power... to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" he said.\n\nBut with several lawmakers already openly calling for Biden to step aside and more expressing worries, \"the dam has broken,\" Clooney said, asking more come forward.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\nThe Oscar-winner brushed aside worries that Biden's exit would create chaos four months before an election in which the Democrats hope to keep Trump from power, and did not endorse a replacement candidate.\n\n\"We Democrats have a very exciting bench. We don't anoint leaders or fall sway to a cult of personality; we vote for a president,\" he said.\n\nThe party should hear from contenders such as Vice President Kamala Harris, Maryland Governor Wes Moore and others, Clooney wrote, \"then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nbur-des/bgs\n\nMore from this section\n\nVice Capital Markets Launches Integration {"uri": "8219108824", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:00:22", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:00:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:59:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://baynews9.com/fl/tampa/news/2024/07/10/george-clooney-biden-democrats-", "title": "Democratic donor George Clooney urges Biden to step aside", "body": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Democratic donor who recently hosted a star-studded Hollywood fundraiser last month for Joe Biden that broke records, became the latest public figure to call for the incumbent president to leave the race.\n\nIn an op-ed for The New York Times on Wednesday, Clooney, who described himself as a \"lifelong Democrat,\" called Biden a \"hero\" who \"saved democracy in 2020,\" and can do so again in November by stepping aside for a new Democratic nominee.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president,\" the former \"ER\" star wrote in his opinion piece. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time,\" Clooney continued. \"None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010,\" referencing his offhanded 2010 remark to then-President Barack Obama about the passage of the Affordable Care Act.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020,\" Clooney added. \"He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney expressed his fears that Biden's performance at last month's debate, which has sparked fear among Democrats in the days since, would translate to not only a return to Republican Donald Trump in November, but would quash hopes of retaking the House of Representatives and result in the U.S. Senate flipping to GOP control.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" Clooney charged. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nAt least nine sitting congressional Democrats have publicly called on Biden to exit the race, despite his repeated insistence that he is staying on the ticket. While Democratic leaders and several other prominent figures have reiterated their support for the incumbent, the party is far from unified. Ex-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said earlier Wednesday that congressional Democrats are encouraging Biden Biden to make a decision soon about whether he's remaining in the race for the White House.\n\n\"It's up to the president to decide if he is going to run,\" Pelosi, D-Calif., said during an interview on MSNBC's \"Morning Joe.\" \"We're all encouraging him to to make that decision because time is running short.\" (A spokesperson for Pelosi later clarified that the California Democrat \"fully supports whatever President Biden decides to do\" and the party \"must turn our attention\" to defeating Trump.)\n\nClooney called on Pelosi and other leaders, namely Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., and House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries, D-N.Y., to ask Biden to step aside.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" he said. \"We all think Republicans should abandon their nominee now that he's been convicted of 34 felonies. That's new and upsetting information as well.\"\n\nClooney, the star of \"Oceans Eleven\" and \"O Brother, Where Art Thou?,\" praised the \"very exciting bench\" of Democrats as he pleaded for a new nominee, writing: \"We can easily foresee a group of several strong Democrats stepping forward to stand and tell us why they're best qualified to lead this country and take on some of the deeply concerning trends we're seeing from the revenge tour that Donald Trump calls a presidential campaign.\"\n\n\"Let's hear from [Maryland Gov.] Wes Moore and [Vice President] Kamala Harris and [Michigan Gov.] Gretchen Whitmer and [California Gov.] Gavin Newsom and [Kentucky Gov.] Andy Beshear and [Illinois Gov.] J.B. Pritzker and others,\" the former \"Batman\" wrote. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes,\" said Clooney, who won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for \"Syriana\" in 2005. \"Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would. The short ramp to Election Day would be a benefit for us, not a danger. It would give us the chance to showcase the future without so much opposition research and negative campaigning that comes with these ridiculously long and expensive election seasons.\"\n\n\"This can be an exciting time for democracy, as we've just seen with the 200 or so French candidates who stepped aside and put their personal ambitions on hold to save their democracy from the far right,\" he concluded. \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nClooney headlined a star-studded Hollywood fundraiser for Biden last month alongside Julia Roberts, Jimmy Kimmel and Obama that raised a record thirty-plus million dollars for the incumbent Democrat's campaign.", "source": {"uri": "baynews9.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Spectrum News Bay News 9"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8219277986", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:26:31", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:26:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:23:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.postandcourier.com/arena/the-spun/george-clooney-tells-joe-biden-to-drop-out-of-2024-presidential-election/article_58a7359b-8a2f-5aa3-996e-1f17a0cbc3f3.html", "title": "George Clooney Tells Joe Biden To Drop Out Of 2024 Presidential Election", "body": "Academy Award winner George Clooney has never been one to hide his political beliefs. Over the years, he has made it abundantly clear that he's a Democrat. With that said, he's hoping his political party can urge Joe Biden to step aside before this year's presidential election.\n\nIn an op-ed for The New York Times, Clooney explained that it's nothing personal against Biden. If anything, he's a huge supporter of the president.\n\nAt the end of the day though, Clooney is worried about Biden's age. After all, he's set to turn 82 this November.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney wrote. \"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nClooney then said that he believes the Democratic Party will lose if Biden is their nominee for the upcoming election. That's something he doesn't want to see happen.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" Clooney wrote. \"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nThese comments from Clooney are bound to spark a conversation on social media. Will it spark change though? {"uri": "8219290321", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:36:33", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:36:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:36:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7921568751335144, "url": "https://www.dailywire.com/news/george-clooney-joins-chorus-of-stars-telling-biden-its-time-to-drop-out-of-race", "title": "George Clooney Joins Chorus Of Stars Telling Biden It's Time To Drop Out Of Race", "body": "George Clooney has joined a growing number of stars who have started to tell President Joe Biden it's time to drop out of the race following the president's disastrous debate.\n\nIn a lengthy editorial in The New York Times, the 63-year-old actor lists the reasons Biden needs to drop out of the 2024 election and allow someone else to run for the Democratic Party after Biden struggled, rambled, and froze numerous times during the CNN Presidential Debate against former President Donald Trump.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney, who hosted a star-studded fundraiser in Hollywood for Biden in June, wrote. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can,\" he added.\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney continued. \"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\"\n\nThe Hollywood star said it is fair to point this out and said it's \"about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" the actor wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate...We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power, and all of the traits that made it so formidable with Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush, to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks.\"\n\n\"But the dam has broken,\" he added.\"We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\"\n\nAt one point, Clooney also called on top Democrats to \"ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy,\" Clooney wrote. \"But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would...Biden, is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nRob Reiner, who has called for Biden to step down, posted the Times piece and wrote on X, \"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying. Some Democrats are calling for Biden to drop out of the race, while others are vowing to stick by his campaign.\n\nOn Wednesday, July 10, a major Democrat in the entertainment world -- actor George Clooney -- called for members of his party to find another presidential candidate.\n\nIn a guest op-ed published by the New York Times, Clooney writes, \"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. Pritzker and others,\" the actor says. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nClooney adds, \"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. It would give us the chance to showcase the future without so much opposition research and negative campaigning that comes with these ridiculously long and expensive election seasons.\"\n\nA Biden {"uri": "8219044172", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:11:54", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:11:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:11:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.businessinsider.nl/george-clooney-says-biden-should-drop-out-cant-win-in-november/", "title": "George Clooney says Biden should drop out, can't win in November", "body": "George Clooney called on Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 race. Clooney said that Biden was as diminished at a recent mega fundraiser as he was during the disastrous debate. There continues to be uneasiness within the Democratic Party as Biden tries to press on.\n\nGeorge Clooney on Wednesday called on President Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 race just weeks after co-hosting a star-studded fundraiser for the president's campaign.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote in a column for The New York Times. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nKeeping Biden on the ballot, Clooney said would court disaster for the entire party this November.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" the actor wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney's broadside comes as congressional Democrats continue to grapple over what to do about Biden following his disastrous debate performance. Some Hollywood bigwigs, including Netflix cofounder Reed Hastings and IAC chairman Barry Diller, have also backed away from Biden.\n\nBiden has repeatedly declared that he's not going anywhere, but there are still murmurs in Washington and elsewhere about his standing. Before Clooney's column was published, former Speaker Nancy Pelosi notably ignored Biden's declaration that he was staying in the race during an interview on MSNBC. Seven House Democrats, including a pair of the chamber's most vulnerable incumbents, have called on Biden to step aside.\n\nThe president has tried to portray the backlash against him as simply \"the elites,\" something Clooney's public break will likely feed into. But the Academy-Award winner is more than just an A-lister. As he wrote, he's been a loyal Democrat. Clooney, Julia Roberts, and Barbra Streisand helped Biden raise roughly $30 million, a jaw-dropping sum, during a June fundraising event that also featured former President Barack Obama.\n\n\"I'm a lifelong Democrat; I make no apologies for that. I'm proud of what my party represents and what it stands for,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nHe added that he help put on, \"some of the biggest fund-raisers in my party's history. Barack Obama in 2012. Hillary Clinton in 2016. Joe Biden in 2020.\"\n\nA representative for Biden's campaign did not immediately respond to a request for comment.\n\nRead the original article on Business Insider", "source": {"uri": "businessinsider.nl", "dataType": "news", "title": "Business Insider Nederland"}, "authors": [{"uri": "brent_d_griffiths@businessinsider.nl", "name": "Brent D. {"uri": "2024-07-417792893", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:14:51", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:14:51Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T14:13:06Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.thehollywoodgossip.com/2024/07/george-clooney-celebrities-against-president-biden-2024/", "title": "George Clooney, Plus More Stars Call for Biden Exit 2024 Election", "body": "George Clooney is calling for President Biden to step aside in favor of a new nominee for the 2024 election. And he's not alone.\n\nDespite being one of the many famous faces to endorse President Biden in the past -- and even very recently -- he has also seemed to grow skittish following the first Presidential debate of the season.\n\nBiden's 2024 reelection bid is a complex decision, for him and for America. It is also a vital one. Particularly as the grim specter of disgraced former president Donald Trump extends across the nation.\n\nJust last month, Clooney was co-hosting Biden fundraisers. Now, he's asking the \"hero\" POTUS to bow out.\n\nPresident Joe Biden should make way for a new nominee, George Clooney argues\n\nOn Wednesday, July 10, George Clooney wrote about President Biden and the 2024 election in a guest column in The New York Times.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney began. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him.\"\n\nHe then elaborated: \"Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time,\" George Clooney lamented pessimistically. \"None of us can.\"\n\nClooney expressed: \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe big F-ing deal Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nBiden's first 2024 presidential debate with his opponent did not go well. And though the opposition party has made it clear in recent years that debates do not matter to them any more than personal conduct or a laundry list of crimes, the Democratic Party seems to lack the will to match that energy. Instead, pundits on the Left have been in a panic, metaphorically running around like headless chickens. And it seems that Clooney feels similarly.\n\nClooney wrote that this was about more than Biden's debate performance\n\nHis NYT op ed also mentioned that he did not find BIden's answers to George Stephanopoulos to adequately explain why he struggled during the debate.\n\nIronically, Stephanopoulos, was approached a day earlier by a stranger in NYC and asked for his thoughts on President Joe Biden's fitness for office.\n\n\"I don't think he can serve four more years,\" candidly replied the ABC News anchor, who had just sat down with Biden a few days earlier for his first on-camera television interview following the CNN presidential debate.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney alleged in his essay.\n\n\"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" Clooney expressed. \"The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before.\"\n\n\"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One, or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question,\" George Clooney then claimed without evidence.\n\nHe highlighted his concern about how this is about more than the Oval Office. This is about retaking the House, about retaining the Senate -- vitally important in holding the line.\n\nAnd then there are state legislatures and governor races, all of which could fall victim to feckless, easily swayed voters who would let hand-wringing pundits or their own general lack of enthusiasm sway their votes -- or prevent them from voting at all. That's not quite how Clooney described it, but still.\n\nOther A-list actors of a certain age share his concerns\n\nClooney repeatedly emphasized that his issue with Biden is age -- and \"nothing more\" than that. And, of course, his fear that America cannot win in November with Biden at the helm.\n\nThat's likely true during this present news cycle. The fact that corporate media grows bored with a topic and moves on to something else is both a blessing and a curse.\n\nUltimately, Clooney may be right or wrong. Come a Second Term Biden or a new nominee, come victory or bitter defeat, there will be no end of hindsight arguments and \"told you so\" arguments. Squabbling is, as always, inevitable and self-defeating.\n\nAlso on Wednesday, Michael Douglas appeared as a guest on The View. Though he was not there to address the (very new at the time) op ed, he did weigh in on George Clooney's argument.\n\n\"This is such a tough one. I adore the guy. Fifty years of public service, a wonderful guy, and this just happens to be one of these elections that's just so crucial,\" Douglas remarked.\n\nHe added: \"I don't necessarily worry about today or tomorrow but a year down the line, I worry. {"uri": "2024-07-417684775", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:17:08", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:17:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:05:17Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.kulr8.com/news/national/actor-george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/article_b90bc516-cb23-5aaa-b78b-4f27e1d4eb76.html", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race", "body": "Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney is adding his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race\n\nMovie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\nKinnard reported from Chapin, South Carolina. {"uri": "8219034210", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:04:50", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:04:50Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:04:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7843137383460999, "url": "https://hotair.com/ed-morrissey/2024/07/10/george-clooney-bails-on-biden-hes-definitely-not-fit-for-office-n3791620", "title": "George Clooney Bails on Biden: He's Definitely Not Fit for Office", "body": "Hooray for Hollywood? You can bet that White House and Team Biden staffers won't sing that tune today, not after George Clooney's op-ed in the New York Times. Clooney, a long-time supporter of Biden and the Democrat Party, just stripped both of their main post-debate spin -- the \"one bad night\" narrative.\n\nIt wasn't just a bad night, Clooney writes, and he should know -- because Biden was just as bad three weeks earlier at his fundraiser. And what's more, Clooney declares that he's done with the gaslighting:\n\nI love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\nBut the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\nWas he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\nClooney then accuses Democrat officeholders of a conspiracy of silence:\n\nWe are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\n\nJust how many elected Democrats does Clooney know? Most of them, probably, because he raises money for them constantly. That's damning information all on its own, underscoring the rank dishonesty of Democrats about Biden's condition. Although Clooney doesn't address it, it also raises questions about why the DNC opted to prevent any challenge to Biden in the primaries despite obvious evidence of his cognitive decline, going back to at least April 2022 when the Easter Bunny ordered Biden away from reporters on the White House lawn.\n\nWhat does Clooney want? He proposes what Jon Stewart proposed on Monday evening -- an emergency open convention. Clooney dismisses talk of difficulties and legal obstacles, not to mention that other Democrats and factions -- such as Big Labor -- have already lined up behind Biden:\n\nLet's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others. Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\n\nWould it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would.\n\nAll of this is predicated, however, on Clooney's \"hero\" withdrawing from the nomination. Biden has already made it clear he won't go quietly, or at all. Clooney's op-ed probably intends to shame Biden into changing his mind, but that's not going to change Biden's lifelong aspiration to this particular office and his grip on it. Nor will it change the fact that the Biden family businesses are all tied to Biden's grip on power, and that a withdrawal will put an end to the cashflow, permanently. And it also ignores that this will rip off the bandage on factional disputes that nearly derailed the Democrats in 2020 without any way to resolve them in a few short weeks of what would be merely a televised \"smoke filled back room\" to determine who wields the power within the party.\n\nThe time for Clooney to speak up was in 2023, or 2022, when public evidence made Biden's decline obvious to everyone. For that matter, why didn't Clooney himself speak up after the fundraiser, or immediately after the debate? He's part of the gaslighting brigade; he's only speaking out now because it's clear that the con has stopped working.", "source": {"uri": "hotair.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "HotAir"}, {"uri": "8219349050", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "20:34:55", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T20:34:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T20:34:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7843137383460999, "url": "https://www.boston.com/news/politics/2024/07/10/actor-george-clooney-a-high-profile-biden-supporter-and-fundraiser-asks-president-to-leave-race/", "title": "Actor George Clooney, a high-profile Biden supporter and fundraiser, asks president to leave race", "body": "Movie star and lifelong Democrat George Clooney added his voice to calls for Joe Biden to leave the presidential race on Wednesday, just weeks after headlining a fundraiser that brought in a record single-night haul for the president's reelection campaign.\n\nClooney said in a New York Times opinion piece that he loves Biden, but the party would lose the presidential race as well as any control in Congress with him as the nominee.\n\n\"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private,\" wrote Clooney. He's hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month.\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favor, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nFocusing much of his piece around Biden's age, Clooney noted differences he saw in the 81-year-old president during their recent Los Angeles event compared to years past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nLast month, Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for a fundraiser that took in a record $30 million-plus for Biden, in hopes of energizing would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in U.S. history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterization of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nAsked for comment on Clooney's essay, Biden's campaign pointed to the president's letter to congressional Democrats earlier in the week vowing to stay in the race.\n\nHis team also disputed the actor's representation of Biden's demeanor during the Los Angeles fundraiser, with campaign officials who attended the event pointing out that the president stayed for more than three hours at the event, despite just having returned from Europe.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign. Leading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid after his weak debate performance against presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump on June 27.\n\nKinnard reported from Chapin, South Carolina. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney continued. \"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nDespite his disastrous debate performance against Donald Trump last month, Biden has thus far resisted calls to drop out of the 2024 presidential race. We need him to do it again in 2024,' the actor wrote in an op-ed for the New York Times.\n\nClooney, who hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden in Los Angeles on June 16, said the person he saw there was the candidate the world saw at last week's presidential debate.\n\n'I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,' Clooney wrote.\n\n'But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,' he said.\n\nGeorge Clooney, President Joe Biden, Julia Roberts and Barack Obama at the June 16 fundraiser\n\nBiden and Clooney have a long relationship, going back to Biden's day as chairman of the Senate Foreign Services Committee. Clooney was working on issues in Darfar and connected with him.\n\nThe president has honored Clooney for his support, hosting him at the White House for the Kennedy Center Honors in December 2022.\n\nBut the actor was reportedly furious at the White House after Biden attacked an attempt by Amal, Clooney's lawyer wife, to jail the Prime Minister of Israel, it emerged on Thursday.\n\nAmal Clooney off a bid by the chief prosecutor of the International Crminal Court last month to seek the arrest of Benjamin Netanyahu alongside Hamas leaders for war crimes - a move the President denounced as 'outrageous'.\n\nHe reportedly called one of Biden's closest advisers to make his feelings know.\n\nClooney, along with actress Julia Roberts and former President Barack Obama, helped raise $30 million for Biden's campaign last month.\n\nBut the fundraiser was shadowed with questions after a video appeared to show Obama having to guide Biden off stage.\n\nIn the video, Biden and Obama are seen waving and smiling while receiving a standing ovation in the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles.\n\nBiden applauds and gives the audience a thumbs up but then he stops moving as he stares out over the crowd for several long seconds.\n\nThat's when Obama, still smiling and waving, takes Biden by the wrist and gives him a gentle tug. That's when the president appears to snap out of it.\n\nThey proceed to walk off the stage together with Obama speaking into Biden's ear as he pats him on the back as they go.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8219143828", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:27:25", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:27:25Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:26:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://www.westernjournal.com/george-clooney-calls-biden-drop-race-just-weeks-hosting-glitzy-fundraiser/", "title": "George Clooney Calls On Biden to Drop Out of Race, Just Weeks After Hosting Glitzy Fundraiser for Him", "body": "Actor and director George Clooney on Wednesday called on President Joe Biden to voluntarily step aside and not seek a second term in office.\n\nThe A-list star's pronouncement came just weeks after he and actress Julia Roberts, as well as former presidents Barack Obama and Bill Clinton, participated in a star-studded recorded-breaking $30 million fundraiser for the president's re-election in Los Angeles.\n\nIn an piece for The New York Times, Clooney wrote, \"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" the actor continued.\n\n\"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney shared.\n\nBiden made headlines at the L.A. fundraiser in mid-June when he appeared to freeze and was led offstage by Obama.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw [at the debate],\" Clooney wrote. \"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second [Donald] Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign.\"\n\n\"The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" he added.\n\nDuring a Friday sit-down with the ABC host, Biden could not recall whether he had even watched his June 27 debate against Donald Trump afterward.\n\nAnd when Stephanopoulos asked the president, \"Did you know how badly it was going?\", Biden gave an incoherent response, saying he prepared for the debate in \"explicit detail.\"\n\n\"And I realized about part way through ...\" he continued and then didn't finish his thought, but noted, \"The New York Times had me down at 10 points before the debate, nine now, or whatever the hell it is.\"\n\n\"The fact of the matter is that what I looked at is [Trump] also lied 28 times, I mean, the way the debate ran. Not ... my fault, no one else's fault,\" Biden said.\n\nClooney predicted, \"We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside,\" he asserted.\n\nClooney suggested that the party consider Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, Vice President Kamala Harris, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, and Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker among others to replace Biden.\n\nHe argued that making a pick so close to the election will actually help Democrats because it will give Republicans less time to effectively conduct opposition research and convey what they learned to voters.\n\nThe Hollywood star concluded, \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nBiden is facing increasing calls within his party to step aside and allow Democrats to nominate a new candidate at the party's convention next month in It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" the actor continued. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\"\n\nClooney said that he is among many who hold this belief, including senators, congressional members, and governors that he has spoken with privately, since the debate. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly,\" he said.\n\nClooney cited intense concerns about Biden's age, comparing his experience with the President at other fundraising events over the years.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? he continued. \"It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\nClooney just recently participated in a fundraiser for the Biden-Harris campaign, using his appearance for a contest of small-dollar voters to win a chance to attend the fundraiser and meet the actor and others. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney argued the party should pick a new nominee at its convention next month, saying the process would be \"messy\" but \"wake up\" voters in the party's favour, mentioning Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan and Gavin Newsom of California among those from who the country should now hear.\n\nClooney has hosted several high-dollar Hollywood fundraisers, including for Biden last month, which brought in a record single-night haul of $US30 million-plus (approx. $45 million) for the president's re-election campaign.\n\nLast month, Clooney, Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage for the fundraiser in hopes of energising would-be supporters for a White House contest they said may rank among the most consequential in US history.\n\nClooney isn't alone in his characterisation of his recent exchange with Biden.\n\nA person who interacted closely with Biden described the president as vibrant and engaging at a fundraiser in March but, at the Los Angeles event months later, said they noticed a notable diminishment in Biden's presence.\n\nThe person, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss private interactions with the president, recalled being struck by how tired and \"out of it\" the president seemed during backstage conversations at the Los Angeles event, adding that they gave Biden the benefit of the doubt for not being as voluble and showing lower energy off-stage because he arrived in Los Angeles after traveling from Italy where he had attended an international summit.\n\nFor a daily dose of 9Honey, subscribe to our newsletter here.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign.\n\nLeading up to the fundraiser, Clooney's name appeared on numerous fundraising missives from the campaign, which he called \"the fight of our lives\".\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney did not immediately return a message seeking comment on insight into his decision, when precisely he had made it or how recently he had spoken with Biden.\n\nBiden has refused to end his reelection bid {"uri": "2024-07-417664253", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "15:58:45", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T15:58:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:29:15Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://www.aol.com/george-clooney-says-joe-biden-152915974.html", "title": "George Clooney Says Joe Biden Must Step Down, Weeks After Co-Hosting Fundraiser for Him: Democrats 'Are Not Going to Win With This President'", "body": "George Clooney Says Joe Biden Must Step Down, Weeks After Co-Hosting Fundraiser for Him: Democrats 'Are Not Going to Win With This President'\n\nZack Sharf\n\nJuly 10, 2024 at 5:29 PM\n\nGeorge Clooney has written an op-ed for The New York Times in which he joins the growing number of Hollywood voices urging Joe Biden to step down as the 2024 Democratic nominee for president. Clooney, who co-hosted a huge Hollywood fundraiser for Biden in June that raised a record $28 million, has seemingly changed his tune after Biden's disastrous performance in the first presidential debate against Donald Trump.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president,\" Clooney wrote. \"I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\nMore from Variety\n\nGeorge Stephanopoulos Says He 'Shouldn't Have' Commented on President Joe Biden's Ability to Serve Second Term\n\nMichael Moore Calls Joe Biden's Disastrous Debate the 'Cruelest Form of Elder Abuse I've Ever Been Forced to Watch ... He Was in Epic Distress'\n\nJon Stewart on Calls for Biden to Drop Out: 'I Am in No Way Saying' He Should, but 'Can't We Open Up the Conversation?'\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time,\" he continued, \"None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney noted that Democrats have been \"all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign\" when it comes to Biden's aging. The Oscar winner said that Biden's post-debate interview with ABC News and George Stephanopoulos \"only reinforced\" that Biden should not be the Democratic nominee.\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more,\" Clooney wrote. \"But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\n\"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024,\" Clooney concluded.\n\nClooney is one of many Hollywood names who have now spoken out against Biden remaining the Democratic nominee, including Rob Reiner, Stephen King and Michael Moore. The latter said on a recent episode of his \"Rumble\" podcast that Biden's disastrous debate was \"the cruelest form of elder abuse I've ever been forced to watch.\"\n\n\"This is not about whether he's fit to serve another four years,\" Moore added about Biden. \"After what we saw on debate night, this is about whether he should serve another four days in the toughest job in the world. That's the question we should be asking. Leave Mr. Biden alone! Let him rest. Let him go home. He has done his job. Let him have his dignity. Please. Do him this favor.\"\n\nDuring his interview with ABC News following the debate, Biden pushed back against his critics and stressed he currently has no intention of dropping out of the presidential race.\n\nHead over to The New York Times' website to read Clooney's op-ed in its entirety.\n\nBest of Variety\n\nAwards Season Calendar (2024-2025): Key Dates and Timeline for Oscars, Emmys, Golden Globes, Grammys, SAG and More\n\nHere's Where To Buy Retro Arcade1Up Cabinets To Re-Live Your Childhood Online\n\nNew Movies Out Now in Theaters: What to See This Week\n\nSign up for Variety's Newsletter. {"uri": "8219146333", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:29:09", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:29:09Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:28:43Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://abc7.com/post/george-clooney-says-president-joe-biden-should-step/15048797/", "title": "George Clooney, who co-hosted recent Biden fundraiser, says president should step aside", "body": "President Joe Biden is determined to stay in the race. Democrats are facing a choice: Whether to stick with Biden or call on him to drop out.\n\nActor George Clooney, who just weeks ago hosted a fundraiser for President Joe Biden's reelection campaign, called for the president to exit the 2024 race in a New York Times op-ed published Wednesday.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney wrote.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney's comments go against Biden's claims that the debate was just one \"bad night\" or a \"bad episode,\" as he told ABC News anchor George Stephanopoulos in Biden's first post-debate television interview.\n\nMORE | Biden dismisses concerns about mental fitness, says he'd drop out if the 'Lord Almighty' told him\n\nAlso, the stinging language lands Clooney among the growing chorus of Democrats -- from elected officials to high-profile donors -- asking the president to allow another, younger nominee to lead the Democratic Party's ticket.\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy,\" wrote Clooney. \"But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would.\"\n\n\"The short ramp to Election Day would be a benefit for us, not a danger,\" Clooney continued. \"It would give us the chance to showcase the future without so much opposition research and negative campaigning that comes with these ridiculously long and expensive election seasons.\"\n\nA Biden campaign official did not respond directly to the op-ed, but pointed ABC News to Biden's recent comments insisting he is remaining in the race, including his Monday letter to Democratic lawmakers where he said he's \"firmly committed\" to staying in the race to the end.\n\nBiden praised Clooney's character at a 2022 White House reception for the Kennedy Center Honorees -- a group that included Clooney.\n\n\"One thing I respect most about George -- and I mean this sincerely -- is his deep empathy,\" Biden said, adding that \"he always remembers where he came from.\"\n\nAfter describing Clooney's advocacy work, including on guns, Biden said, \"He knows the work remains unfinished, yet he is unrelenting and undaunted. He also supported Biden's 2020 campaign -- and, until Wednesday, his 2024 campaign.\n\nClooney himself had previously ruled out a career in politics. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" he said.\n\nClooney added that Democratic Party leaders need to cease and desist from gaslighting voters by \"telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw.\"\n\n\"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" he said.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" he continued, adding later that his opinion is shared by \"every senator and congress member and governor\" he has spoken to privately since the debate.\n\nThe actor and activist also compared the reaction from Democrats to how Republicans have ceded their party to Trump -- \"a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency\" -- and chided members of Congress for \"opting to wait and see if the dam breaks\" rather than speaking up.\n\n\"We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we But We Need a New Nominee,\" Clooney admits that \"the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser ... was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\" Clooney, well-connected in the Democratic Party as a donor and activist who even managed to have Biden's ear on the topic of Israel and Gaza, says that \"every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private\" thinks Biden will lose. \"Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly,\" Clooney said.\n\nClooney goes on to say that Biden is old, a problem that can't be reversed, and that he and other Democrats \"collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\" There is one glaring alarm in this piece though, and it is that admission Clooney makes early on: \"the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser ... was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney saw in private the exact same Biden that stumbled through both the debate and an interview with former Democratic operative George Stephanopoulos and admitted as much. He knew that Biden could not function in unscripted interactions and, like the whole of liberal media and like Biden's team, was willing to ignore that fact to continue to promote Biden until the debate made that implausible. Had that debate not happened yet, Clooney would not be calling for Biden to step down, even though he has seen that very same Biden that the country saw at his lavish celebrity fundraisers.\n\nCLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER\n\nThis is exactly how this has played out in liberal media as well, with reporters acknowledging back in February that they should be talking about Biden's age more only to label any video showing Biden's verbal, mental, and physical stumbles as a \"cheap fake\" or \"disinformation.\" Democratic activists, politicians, and liberal media were all content to promote Biden as being sharper than all his aides behind the scenes up until the debate shattered that narrative that they, like Clooney, knew was false.\n\nClooney and other Biden allies in media and politics were fully willing to lie to the public about Biden's condition up until that lie was impossible to maintain. They were willing to pretend that Biden was fine and competent so long as he hid from unscripted interactions (such as press conferences, which Biden has avoided for most of his presidency) and read off a teleprompter every once and a while. They were ready to lock in four more years of what the country saw in the debate and smear everyone who noticed as a conspiracy theorist, and that should stick with their reputation forever.", Rolf Vennenbernd / picture alliance via Getty Images file\n\nActor George Clooney published a guest essay in The New York Times on Wednesday calling for Democratic leaders to coalesce behind a new presidential nominee amid mounting pressure from within the party for President Joe Biden to withdraw from the race.\n\nClooney, a major Democratic fundraiser, issued his call as prominent Democrats continue to step forward to question Biden's ability to win re-election against former President Donald Trump following the president's debate performance last month.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nNBC News has reached out to the Biden campaign for comment.\n\nAmid Democratic handwringing in the days since the debate, Biden has defied calls to drop out and has dismissed polling broadly showing him trailing Trump in key states, although often within the margin of error.\n\nDemocratic donors, meanwhile, have been divided on how to chart a path forward on a nominee amid the dissension. Referring to the debate, Clooney, who called himself friend of Biden, wrote that party leaders \"need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he added. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nDespite some defections, prominent Democrats in Congress have continued to voice support for Biden -- albeit waveringly -- after closed-door meetings following their return to the Capitol this week.\n\nIn his essay, Clooney also skewered Biden's argument in a letter to members of Congress that his victory in the Democratic primaries show he has the support of voters.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" he wrote.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face {"uri": "8219347884", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "20:34:29", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T20:34:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T20:32:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://conservativeangle.com/george-clooney-jettisons-joe-biden/", "title": "George Clooney Jettisons Joe Biden - Conservative Angle", "body": "Actor George Clooney is a massive Democrat fundraiser and a lifelong Democrat voter. Today, he wrote a guest Op/Ed in the New York Times calling for his friend Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 Presidential Race and for a new candidate to be named. Well after all, when you've lost George Clooney, there goes the money. Doctor Jill is stamping her tiny feet and shaking her tiny fists.\n\nClooney's Op-Ed begins with him telling us how much George Clooney has done for the Democrat Party in the column titled, \"I Love Joe Biden. But We Need a New Nominee.\".\n\nI'm a lifelong Democrat; I make no apologies for that. I'm proud of what my party represents and what it stands for. As part of my participation in the democratic process and in support of my chosen candidate, I have led some of the biggest fund-raisers in my party's history. Barack Obama in 2012. Hillary Clinton in 2016. Joe Biden in 2020. Last month I co-hosted the single largest fund-raiser supporting any Democratic candidate ever, for President Biden's re-election. I say all of this only to express how much I believe in this process and how profound I think this moment is.\n\nDayum y'all, George Clooney is effing wonderful even if he does say so himself. He has deep, deep pockets and if he doesn't know where more deep, deep pockets are, his wife, Amal Clooney does.\n\nWith these next words, George Clooney becomes Brutus to Joe Biden's Caesar:\n\nI love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\nBut the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\nEt tu, Brute?\n\nHold up there Cowboy Clooney. \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. In the op-ed, Clooney said that the Biden he saw at a June 15 fundraising event for the president's reelection bid was the same Biden at the debate, referring to his mental difficulties.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nDespite Clooney's admission that Biden appeared in decline at the June fundraiser, his op-ed was published on July 10.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added. \"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before.\"\n\nDuring an interview with ABC News host George Stephanopoulos, a former Clinton administration official, Biden repeatedly dismissed polls showing him trailing Trump.\n\nBiden's age and mental fitness were issues dogging the president's campaign before the June 27 debate. On multiple occasions, Biden said he spoke with people who had died, including claiming Feb. 8 to have spoken with former German Chancellor Helmut Kohl about the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the Capitol, even though Kohl died in 2017.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" Clooney wrote. \"We all think Republicans should abandon their nominee now that he's been convicted of 34 felonies. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe actor's blunt assessment comes at a critical time for Biden, who faces calls from more than a dozen Democratic lawmakers to bow out before it's too late. The New York Times editorial board has urged Biden to step aside in two separate op-eds, saying he has \"continued to appear as a man in decline\" in the wake of the debate.\n\nOn Wednesday morning, former House speaker Nancy Pelosi suggested Biden could still change his mind about his re-election bid and refused to say whether she personally feels the president should press on with his campaign.\n\n\"It's up to the president to [decide] if he's going to run. We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short,\" she insisted.\n\nClooney, a longtime supporter of the Democratic Party whose wife, Amal Clooney, is a prominent human rights attorney, insists he \"loves\" Biden as a senator, vice president, and president, praising the many \"battles\" he's won since taking office in January 2021.\n\nBut Biden's halting, often confused and generally low-energy appearance on an Atlanta debate stage opposite Trump was consistent with what he observed from the 81-year-old president when he hosted him at the record-breaking fundraising event last month, Clooney wrote.\n\nIt was reported last month that Clooney's attendance at that Los Angeles fundraiser was thrown into doubt after the actor directly called a top Biden aide to complain about the administration's rebuke of an international arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a case that his wife had backed. But the actor and the president have enjoyed a long and warm relationship, with Biden praising Clooney in 2022 for his \"deep empathy.\"\n\nIn his op-ed, Clooney said Democratic Party leaders need to stop \"telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw\" after the June 27 debate.\n\n\"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" he said.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? to privately since the debate.\n\nThe actor and activist also compared the reaction from Democrats to how Republicans have ceded their party to Trump -- \"a single person who seeks to hold on to the
