{"uri": "8219098241", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:51:33", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:51:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:51:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "http://mynewsla.com/hollywood/2024/07/10/weeks-after-la-fundraiser-clooney-calls-on-biden-to-end-reelection-bid/", "title": "Weeks After LA Fundraiser, Clooney Calls on Biden to End Reelection Bid - MyNewsLA.com", "body": "Just weeks after co-hosting a record-setting downtown Los Angeles fundraiser for Joe Biden's reelection campaign, actor and major Democratic Party donor George Clooney said Wednesday the president needs to step aside amid concerns about his age and ability to run the country.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in an essay published Wednesday in The New York Times. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe big F-ing deal Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nOn June 15, Clooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden at the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles. The Biden campaign said the event raised a record-setting $28 million. In addition to Clooney, actress Julia Roberts was on hand for the event, along with Jack Black, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Jason Bateman and Kathryn Hahn. Jimmy Kimmel moderated a discussion between Biden and former President Barack Obama.\n\nElected officials in attendance included Gov. Gavin Newsom, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass, and Reps. Nanette Barrag\u00c3\u00a1n, D-San Pedro; Tony C\u00c3\u00a1rdenas, D-Pacoima, Robert Garcia, D-Long Beach, Ted Lieu, D-Torrance, Grace Napolitano, D-Norwalk, and Maxine Waters, D-Los Angeles.\n\nBut questions about Biden's stamina and presidential credentials have heightened following his woeful performance in a CNN debate against presumptive Republican candidate Donald Trump. Biden has worked in the days since the debate to reassure Democrats and voters about his commitment and ability to run the country, but Clooney wrote in his essay that he remains unconvinced.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\n\"... This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and Congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney did not offer an opinion on who should replace Biden as the Democratic candidate, but said there should be a process for potential candidates to make a case for themselves.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others,\" Clooney wrote. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. {"uri": "8219139471", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:23:19", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:23:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:22:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://en-volve.com/2024/07/10/hollywood-star-who-helped-raise-millions-for-joe-biden-calls-on-him-to-step-down/", "title": "Hollywood Star Who Helped Raise Millions For Joe Biden Calls On Him To Step Down", "body": "From 100PercentFedUp - READ ORIGINAL\n\nSome media, including videos, may only be available to view at the original.\n\nShare this:\n\nHollywood superstar George Clooney, who helped raise $30 million for Joe Biden at a fundraiser last month, has called on him to withdraw from the presidential election.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. But we need a new nominee,\" Clooney wrote in an op-ed for The New York Times.\n\nClooney wrote in The New York Times:\n\nI'm a lifelong Democrat; I make no apologies for that. I'm proud of what my party represents and what it stands for. As part of my participation in the democratic process and in support of my chosen candidate, I have led some of the biggest fund-raisers in my party's history. Barack Obama in 2012. Hillary Clinton in 2016. Joe Biden in 2020. Last month I co-hosted the single largest fund-raiser supporting any Democratic candidate ever, for President Biden's re-election. I say all of this only to express how much I believe in this process and how profound I think this moment is.\n\nI love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\nBut the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\nWas he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\nIs it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\n\nWATCH:\n\n\"Some of Hollywood's brightest stars headlined a fundraiser for President Joe Biden that took in a record $30 million-plus for a Democratic candidate,\" the Associated Press reported last month.\n\nWATCH:\n\nFrom the Associated Press:\n\nGeorge Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage at the 7,100-seat Peacock Theater in Los Angeles on Saturday night. Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel interviewed Biden and former President Barack Obama, who both stressed the need to defeat former President Donald Trump in a race that's expected to be exceedingly close.\n\nDuring more than half an hour of discussion, Kimmel asked if the country was suffering from amnesia about the presumptive Republican nominee, to which Biden responded, \"all we gotta do is remember what it was like\" when Trump was in the White House.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign, and just how important the event was to his reelection bid could be seen in Biden's decision to fly through the night across nine time zones, from the G7 summit in southern Italy to Southern California, to attend.\n\nIn addition to Clooney urging Biden to drop out of the race, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi would not explicitly throw her support behind him.\n\n[WATCH] Nancy Pelosi Asked If Joe Biden Has Her Support", "source": {"uri": "en-volve.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "enVolve"}, "authors": [{"uri": "a_m_smith@en-volve.com", "name": "A.M. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nClooney's comments go against Biden's claims that the debate was just one \"bad night\" or a \"bad episode,\" as he told ABC News anchor George Stephanopoulos in Biden's first post-debate television interview.\n\nMORE | Biden dismisses concerns about mental fitness, says he'd drop out if the 'Lord Almighty' told him\n\nAlso, the stinging language lands Clooney among the growing chorus of Democrats -- from elected officials to high-profile donors -- asking the president to allow another, younger nominee to lead the Democratic Party's ticket.\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy,\" wrote Clooney. \"But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would.\"\n\n\"The short ramp to Election Day would be a benefit for us, not a danger,\" Clooney continued. \"It would give us the chance to showcase the future without so much opposition research and negative campaigning that comes with these ridiculously long and expensive election seasons.\"\n\nA Biden campaign official did not respond directly to the op-ed, but pointed ABC News to Biden's recent comments insisting he is remaining in the race, including his Monday letter to Democratic lawmakers where he said he's \"firmly committed\" to staying in the race to the end.\n\nBiden praised Clooney's character at a 2022 White House reception for the Kennedy Center Honorees -- a group that included Clooney.\n\n\"One thing I respect most about George -- and I mean this sincerely -- is his deep empathy,\" Biden said, adding that \"he always remembers where he came from.\"\n\nAfter describing Clooney's advocacy work, including on guns, Biden said, \"He knows the work remains unfinished, yet he is unrelenting and undaunted. {"uri": "8219098240", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "16:51:46", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T16:51:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T16:51:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "http://mynewsla.com/hollywood/2024/07/10/weeks-after-la-fundraiser-clooney-calls-on-biden-to-end-reelection-bid-2/", "title": "Weeks After LA Fundraiser, Clooney Calls on Biden to End Reelection Bid - MyNewsLA.com", "body": "Just weeks after co-hosting a record-setting downtown Los Angeles fundraiser for Joe Biden's reelection campaign, actor and major Democratic Party donor George Clooney said Wednesday the president needs to step aside amid concerns about his age and ability to run the country.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in an essay published Wednesday in The New York Times. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe big F-ing deal Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nOn June 15, Clooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden at the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles. The Biden campaign said the event raised a record-setting $28 million. In addition to Clooney, actress Julia Roberts was on hand for the event, along with Jack Black, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Jason Bateman and Kathryn Hahn. Jimmy Kimmel moderated a discussion between Biden and former President Barack Obama.\n\nElected officials in attendance included Gov. Gavin Newsom, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass, and Reps. Nanette Barrag\u00c3\u00a1n, D-San Pedro; Tony C\u00c3\u00a1rdenas, D-Pacoima, Robert Garcia, D-Long Beach, Ted Lieu, D-Torrance, Grace Napolitano, D-Norwalk, and Maxine Waters, D-Los Angeles.\n\nBut questions about Biden's stamina and presidential credentials have heightened following his woeful performance in a CNN debate against presumptive Republican candidate Donald Trump. Biden has worked in the days since the debate to reassure Democrats and voters about his commitment and ability to run the country, but Clooney wrote in his essay that he remains unconvinced.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\n\"... This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and Congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney did not offer an opinion on who should replace Biden as the Democratic candidate, but said there should be a process for potential candidates to make a case for themselves.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others,\" Clooney wrote. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nActor Rob Reiner, another major Democratic Party supporter, called on Biden to step aside over the weekend. In response to Clooney's essay, Reiner wrote on X, \"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying. We love and respect Joe Bide. We acknowledge all he has done for our country. But Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside.\"\n\nAnother major figure in the party, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-California, appeared on MSNBC's \"Morning Joe\" program Wednesday, suggesting that Biden -- despite his insistence about remaining in the race -- could still reconsider.\n\n\"It's up to the president to decide if he's going to run,\" she said. \"We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short.\"\n\nPelosi declined on the show to explicitly endorse Biden, but called on other congressional members to \"hold off\" on making public statements about the incumbent.\n\n\"Whatever you're thinking, either tell somebody privately, but you don't have to put that out on the table until we see how we go this week,\" Pelosi said.\n\nCalifornia Gov. Gavin Newsom, whose name often surfaces as a presidential candidate, has continued to steadfastly support Biden. Newsom was in New Hampshire earlier this week on the Biden campaign trail, insisting that Biden \"is going to be our nominee.\"\n\nAccording to The Hill, Newsom spoke to Biden's campaign staff on a phone call this week, pumping up Biden's reelection bid.\n\n\"Every single event we had, every single stop we had, we exceeded expectations in terms of the number of people that showed up,\" Newsom said, according to The Hill. \"They're not giving into the cynicism. They're not giving into the fear. They're not giving into the anxiety. They're showing up because they care. They care about the work you're doing. They care about this president.\"", "source": {"uri": "mynewsla.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "My News LA"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Clooney", {"uri": "2024-07-417852425", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:37:24", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:37:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:31:02Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.kentucky.com/entertainment/article289937909.html", "title": "George Clooney calls on president to step aside: Aging Biden no longer the man he was", "body": "By Nardine Saad, Los Angeles Times The Tribune Content Agency\n\nLOS ANGELES - Even George Clooney - a mega-donor to President Joe Biden's reelection campaign - appears to have lost faith in the president's ability to win the 2024 election.\n\nThe two-time Oscar winner, lifelong Democrat and high-profile campaign donor has formally asked the 81-year-old commander in chief to step aside so that the party can nominate a new candidate to take on former President Donald Trump on the November ballot. Why? Because of Biden's \"fight against time,\" which Clooney characterized as the only battle that POTUS cannot win.\n\n\"None of us can,\" Clooney wrote Wednesday in an opinion piece for the New York Times titled \"I Love Joe Biden. But We Need a New Nominee.\" \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F- deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nDemocrats took in $30 million at that downtown L.A. fundraiser, setting a record for money generated by the party in a single night. In addition to Clooney, Julia Roberts and former President Barack Obama headlined the event and Jimmy Kimmel acted as emcee.\n\nClooney wrote that Biden was a \"hero\" who had \"saved democracy\" in 2020 and called upon him to \"do it again in 2024.\" But, citing Biden's poor performance during CNN's debate last month, he joined a growing number of Hollywood backers, including those who previously wrote large checks to the campaign, feeling skittish about Biden's prospects despite the president's resolve to remain in the race.\n\nSome of those going public with their angst about Biden include \"Lost\" co-creator Damon Lindelof, Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings, media titan Barry Diller, Disney heir Abigail Disney and Endeavor Chief Executive Ari Emanuel, brother of Rahm Emanuel, who is currently U.S. ambassador to Japan and formerly Obama's chief of staff. Filmmaker Rob Reiner wrote Wednesday on X (formerly Twitter) that \"Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside.\"\n\nIn his op-ed, Clooney wondered if Biden was tired or suffering from a cold during his head-to-head with Trump. But he mostly took issue with the next-day narrative being spun by his party, arguing that Biden's nomination was not yet a sure thing ahead of the Democratic National Convention in August. (The GOP convention starts Monday.)\n\n\"[O]ur party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney wrote. \"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nClooney said it's \"fair\" to point these things out: \"This is about age. Nothing more.\"\n\nHe predicted the Democrats are \"not going to win in November with this president,\" nor would they win the House of Representatives or retain their majority in the Senate. He said this isn't just his opinion, but \"the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\n\"[T]he dam has broken. We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth,\" the \"Argo\" and \"Syriana\" Academy Award winner wrote. \"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information. We all think Republicans should abandon their nominee now that he's been convicted of 34 felonies.\"\n\nAs such, Clooney also criticized the presumptive Republican candidate and \"the revenge tour that Donald Trump calls a presidential campaign\" and called for the Democrats to seriously consider potential replacements. Who? Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, Vice President Kamala Harris, California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear or Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker, he suggests.\n\n\"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nIt would be \"messy,\" he said, but \"democracy is messy\" and a fresh contest would \"enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out.\"\n\nRepresentatives for Clooney said Wednesday that they had \"nothing to add\" and that the essay presented his thinking \"in its entirety.\"\n\nAlso on Wednesday morning, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., sent a rare public signal that suggested she is trying to nudge Biden to consider dropping out of the election, telling MSNBC that it's \"up to the president to decide if he is going to run\" and that \"we're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short.\"", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "8219238576", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:48:03", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:48:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T18:46:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7450980544090271, "url": "http://mynewsla.com/hollywood/2024/07/10/weeks-after-la-fundraiser-clooney-calls-on-biden-to-end-reelection-bid-3/", "title": "Weeks After LA Fundraiser, Clooney Calls on Biden to End Reelection Bid - MyNewsLA.com", "body": "Just weeks after co-hosting a record-setting downtown Los Angeles fundraiser for Joe Biden's reelection campaign, actor and major Democratic Party donor George Clooney said Wednesday the president needs to step aside amid concerns about his age and ability to run the country.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in an essay published Wednesday in The New York Times. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe big F-ing deal Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nOn June 15, Clooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden at the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles. The Biden campaign said the event raised a record-setting $28 million. In addition to Clooney, actress Julia Roberts was on hand for the event, along with Jack Black, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Jason Bateman and Kathryn Hahn. Jimmy Kimmel moderated a discussion between Biden and former President Barack Obama.\n\nElected officials in attendance included Gov. Gavin Newsom, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass, and Reps. Nanette Barrag\u00c3\u00a1n, D-San Pedro; Tony C\u00c3\u00a1rdenas, D-Pacoima, Robert Garcia, D-Long Beach, Ted Lieu, D-Torrance, Grace Napolitano, D-Norwalk, and Maxine Waters, D-Los Angeles.\n\nBut questions about Biden's stamina and presidential credentials have heightened following his woeful performance in a CNN debate against presumptive Republican candidate Donald Trump. Biden has worked in the days since the debate to reassure Democrats and voters about his commitment and ability to run the country.\n\nBass, a longtime Biden supporter, issued a brief statement Wednesday reiterating her backing of the president.\n\n\"I was on a call with the president and mayors from across the country last night,\" Bass wrote on X. \"I'm supporting our nominee, President Joe Biden.\"\n\nNewsom, whose name often surfaces as a potential presidential candidate, has continued to steadfastly support Biden. Newsom was in New Hampshire earlier this week on the Biden campaign trail, insisting that Biden \"is going to be our nominee.\"\n\nAccording to The Hill, Newsom spoke to Biden's campaign staff on a phone call this week, pumping up Biden's reelection bid.\n\n\"Every single event we had, every single stop we had, we exceeded expectations in terms of the number of people that showed up,\" Newsom said, according to The Hill. \"They're not giving into the cynicism. They're not giving into the fear. They're not giving into the anxiety. They're showing up because they care. They care about the work you're doing. They care about this president.\"\n\nClooney wrote in his essay that he remains unconvinced about Biden's stamina.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\n\"... This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and Congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney did not offer an opinion on who should replace Biden as the Democratic candidate, but said there should be a process for potential candidates to make a case for themselves.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others,\" Clooney wrote. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nActor Rob Reiner, another major Democratic Party supporter, called on Biden to step aside over the weekend. In response to Clooney's essay, Reiner wrote on X, \"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying. We love and respect Joe Bide. We acknowledge all he has done for our country. But Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside.\"\n\nAnother major figure in the party, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-California, appeared on MSNBC's \"Morning Joe\" program Wednesday, suggesting that Biden -- despite his insistence about remaining in the race -- could still reconsider.\n\n\"It's up to the president to decide if he's going to run,\" she said. \"We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short.\"\n\nPelosi declined on the show to explicitly endorse Biden, but called on other congressional members to \"hold off\" on making public statements about the incumbent.\n\n\"Whatever you're thinking, either tell somebody privately, but you don't have to put that out on the table until we see how we go this week,\" Pelosi said.\n\nBiden is scheduled to attend a fundraiser in Laguna Beach on July 26.", "source": {"uri": "mynewsla.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "My News LA"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": But she added, \"It's up to the president to decide if he's going to run. We are all encouraging him to make that decision, because time is running short.\"\n\nThe statement is significant for Biden has repeatedly said that he is in the race and the matter is closed. But Pelosi's statement is seen as a sign of the growing disquiet on Capitol Hill where close to a dozen Democratic lawmakers have publicly called on Biden to drop out. But many more representatives and Senators are understood to privately believe that Biden, after his debate performance on June 27, was poised to lose to the presumptive Republican nominee, Donald J Trump. Lawmakers fear that having Biden at the top of the presidential ticket will also have an adverse effect on prospects of Democratic candidates in Senate, House and even some state races.\n\nBiden also got another jolt on Wednesday when actor George Clooney, a lifelong Democrat who just hosted a fund-raiser for Biden last month, called on him to drop out in an essay on the New York Times.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden...But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe..Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney wrote. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nReached for comment, a Biden campaign spokeswoman pointed to the president's previous comments saying that he's staying in the race.\n\nAmid Democratic handwringing in the days since the debate, Biden has defied calls to drop out and has dismissed polling showing him trailing Trump, although broadly within the margin of error.\n\nDemocratic donors, meanwhile, have been divided on how to chart a path forward on a nominee amid the dissension. Clooney praised the president and his character, but said that he was simply too old to run in an election with such high stakes.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. ... In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Clooney wrote. \"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nClooney wrote in dire terms about his belief in Biden's chances in the election:\n\nClooney did not call for Vice President Kamala Harris to take over the top of the ticket as some lawmakers have. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" he said, referring to explanations from the White House and Biden himself for his bad debate performance.\n\nMore bluntly, he said explicitly that Biden could not prevail in an electoral rematch with Trump: \"We are not going to win with this president.\"\n\nStressing that his call was made reluctantly, Clooney paid tribute to the political battles that Biden had won throughout his career but said his age represented an insurmountable adversary.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can,\" he wrote.\n\nClooney's plea came as Biden continues to insist on staying in the race while senior Democrats agonise about how to apply pressure on him to change his mind, and serious questions continue over Biden's health and viability for re-election.\n\nThe actor called on leading party figures to come off the fence and make the case to Biden, while dismissing as \"disingenuous\" the president's argument - stated in a letter to Democrats in Congress this week - that the party's membership had already chosen the nominee in the primaries.\n\n'Most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" he wrote in remarks clearly critical of continuing inaction. \"But the dam has broken. We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\"\n\nHe concluded: \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nClooney's intervention comes weeks after a disagreement with the White House over Biden's criticism of the international criminal court's move to issue an arrest warrant for Israel's prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, over allegations of war crimes in Gaza.\n\nThe actor's wife, Amal Alamuddin Clooney, worked on the case. defense minister, and three leaders of Hamas, which controls Gaza.\n\nShortly afterwards, however, Clooney appeared at a huge fundraising event in Los Angeles for the campaign, which headlined with {"uri": "8219129080", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:15:05", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:15:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:14:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://100percentfedup.com/hollywood-star-who-helped-raise-millions-joe-biden/", "title": "Hollywood Star Who Helped Raise Millions For Joe Biden Calls On Him To Step Down * 100PercentFedUp.com * by Danielle", "body": "Hollywood superstar George Clooney, who helped raise $30 million for Joe Biden at a fundraiser last month, has called on him to withdraw from the presidential election.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. But we need a new nominee,\" Clooney wrote in an op-ed for The New York Times.\n\nI'm a lifelong Democrat; I make no apologies for that. I'm proud of what my party represents and what it stands for. As part of my participation in the democratic process and in support of my chosen candidate, I have led some of the biggest fund-raisers in my party's history. Barack Obama in 2012. Hillary Clinton in 2016. Joe Biden in 2020. Last month I co-hosted the single largest fund-raiser supporting any Democratic candidate ever, for President Biden's re-election. I say all of this only to express how much I believe in this process and how profound I think this moment is.\n\nI love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\nBut the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\nWas he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\nIs it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\n\n\"Some of Hollywood's brightest stars headlined a fundraiser for President Joe Biden that took in a record $30 million-plus for a Democratic candidate,\" the Associated Press reported last month.\n\nGeorge Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barbra Streisand were among those who took the stage at the 7,100-seat Peacock Theater in Los Angeles on Saturday night. Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel interviewed Biden and former President Barack Obama, who both stressed the need to defeat former President Donald Trump in a race that's expected to be exceedingly close.\n\nDuring more than half an hour of discussion, Kimmel asked if the country was suffering from amnesia about the presumptive Republican nominee, to which Biden responded, \"all we gotta do is remember what it was like\" when Trump was in the White House.\n\nLuminaries from the entertainment world have increasingly lined up to help Biden's campaign, and just how important the event was to his reelection bid could be seen in Biden's decision to fly through the night across nine time zones, from the G7 summit in southern Italy to Southern California, to attend.\n\nIn addition to Clooney urging Biden to drop out of the race, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi would not explicitly throw her support behind him.", "source": {"uri": "100percentfedup.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "100 {"uri": "8219301089", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "19:47:35", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T19:47:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T19:45:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "http://mynewsla.com/hollywood/2024/07/10/weeks-after-la-fundraiser-clooney-calls-on-biden-to-end-reelection-bid-4/", "title": "Weeks After LA Fundraiser, Clooney Calls on Biden to End Reelection Bid - MyNewsLA.com", "body": "Just weeks after co-hosting a record-setting downtown Los Angeles fundraiser for Joe Biden's reelection campaign, actor and major Democratic Party donor George Clooney said Wednesday the president needs to step aside amid concerns about his age and ability to run the country.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden,\" Clooney wrote in an essay published Wednesday in The New York Times. \"As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe big F-ing deal Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThere was no immediate reply to emails sent to the Biden-Harris campaign seeking a response to Clooney's comments.\n\nOn June 15, Clooney co-hosted a star-studded fundraiser for Biden at the Peacock Theater in downtown Los Angeles. The Biden campaign said the event raised a record-setting $28 million. In addition to Clooney, actress Julia Roberts was on hand for the event, along with Jack Black, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Jason Bateman and Kathryn Hahn. Jimmy Kimmel moderated a discussion between Biden and former President Barack Obama.\n\nElected officials in attendance included Gov. Gavin Newsom, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass, and Reps. Nanette Barrag\u00c3\u00a1n, D-San Pedro; Tony C\u00c3\u00a1rdenas, D-Pacoima, Robert Garcia, D-Long Beach, Ted Lieu, D-Torrance, Grace Napolitano, D-Norwalk, and Maxine Waters, D-Los Angeles.\n\nBut questions about Biden's stamina and presidential credentials have heightened following his woeful performance in a CNN debate against presumptive Republican candidate Donald Trump. Biden has worked in the days since the debate to reassure Democrats and voters about his commitment and ability to run the country.\n\nBass, a longtime Biden supporter, issued a brief statement Wednesday reiterating her backing of the president.\n\n\"I was on a call with the president and mayors from across the country last night,\" Bass wrote on X. \"I'm supporting our nominee, President Joe Biden.\"\n\nNewsom, whose name often surfaces as a potential presidential candidate, has continued to steadfastly support Biden. Newsom was in New Hampshire earlier this week on the Biden campaign trail, insisting that Biden \"is going to be our nominee.\"\n\nAccording to The Hill, Newsom spoke to Biden's campaign staff on a phone call this week, pumping up Biden's reelection bid.\n\n\"Every single event we had, every single stop we had, we exceeded expectations in terms of the number of people that showed up,\" Newsom said, according to The Hill. \"They're not giving into the cynicism. They're not giving into the fear. They're not giving into the anxiety. They're showing up because they care. They care about the work you're doing. They care about this president.\"\n\nClooney wrote in his essay that he remains unconvinced about Biden's stamina.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\n\"... This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and Congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nClooney did not offer an opinion on who should replace Biden as the Democratic candidate, but said there should be a process for potential candidates to make a case for themselves.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others,\" Clooney wrote. \"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nActor Rob Reiner, another major Democratic Party supporter, called on Biden to step aside over the weekend. In response to Clooney's essay, Reiner wrote on X, \"My friend George Clooney has clearly expressed what many of us have been saying. We love and respect Joe Bide. We acknowledge all he has done for our country. But Democracy is facing an existential threat. We need someone younger to fight back. Joe Biden must step aside.\"\n\nAnother major figure in the party, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-California, appeared on MSNBC's \"Morning Joe\" program Wednesday, suggesting that Biden -- despite his insistence about remaining in the race -- could still reconsider.\n\n\"It's up to the president to decide if he's going to run,\" she said. \"We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short.\"\n\nPelosi declined on the show to explicitly endorse Biden, but called on other congressional members to \"hold off\" on making public statements about the incumbent.\n\n\"Whatever you're thinking, either tell somebody privately, but you don't have to put that out on the table until we see how we go this week,\" Pelosi said.\n\nAnother prominent Southland Democrat, Los Angeles County Supervisor Janice Hahn, told KNX News Wednesday morning she's still behind Biden.\n\n\"I'm supporting him. I'm going to vote for him,\" Hahn said. \"I think Democrats should line up and say we're voting for Joe Biden. Just like the Republicans are lining up and saying we're voting for a convicted felon.\n\n\"I do think Joe Biden does need to own being old, and I think he needs to say, 'We're both old.' President Trump and President Biden are both older, and there's nothing wrong with that,\" she said.\n\nBiden is scheduled to attend a fundraiser in Laguna Beach on July 26.", "source": {"uri": {"uri": "2024-07-417653713", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "15:47:32", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T15:47:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T15:35:27Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://inews.co.uk/news/world/george-clooney-biden-step-down-new-york-times-3162839", "title": "George Clooney calls for Biden to step down in New York Times editorial", "body": "The actor and director has called for Joe Biden to step down, saying \"we need a new nominee\"\n\nActor and Democratic donor George Clooney has called for Joe Biden to step down, saying he loves the President but \"we need a new nominee\" in an editorial piece for the New York Times.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Mr Clooney wrote.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nMr Clooney - who has hosted fundraisers for Hillary Clinton, Barack Obama and Joe Biden said \"our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign.\"\n\nHe also said his private discussions reflected the view that the President could not win in November\n\n\"This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly,\" he wrote.\n\nThe comments come amid ongoing speculation about the 81-year-old President's mental fitness and ability to win the 2024 election and serve another four years in office. The New York Times Editorial Board has already called for Mr Biden to step aside, along with seven Democrats. On Wednesday, Nancy Pelosi urged him to \"make a decision quickly\" on the presidential race.\n\nThe former speaker of the house said on MSNBC she was encouraging her colleagues on Capitol Hill with concerns about Mr Biden to refrain from airing them while he hosts Nato leaders in Washington this week.\n\n\"I've said to everyone: let's just hold off. Whatever you're thinking, either tell somebody privately, but you don't have to put that out on the table until we see how we go this week,\" she said.\n\nShe also declined to say that she wanted Mr Biden to run. \"I want him to do whatever he decides to do,\" she said. \"We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short.\"\n\nMr Biden's campaign referred to a letter Biden sent Democrats in Congress that said he was \"firmly committed\" to staying in the race and beating Trump. But We Need a New Nominee.\"\n\nThe star, who said Biden was his first choice in 2016 election and who excused the president's slipping poll numbers in 2021, comparing Biden to a \"battered child\" on his first day of school, finally crossed the Rubicon on Wednesday.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he declared.\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" he continued.\n\nClooney pleaded with the Democratic party leaders \"to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw\" in Biden's disastrous debate performance against Trump.\n\nClooney co-hosted a glitzy Biden fundraiser in Los Angeles weeks before the debate but \"Pod Save America\" co-host Jon Favreau, who was in attendance, said guests at the event also witnessed \"debate-style bad\" Biden.\n\n\"We all walked out of that fundraiser here in L.A. and we're talking to each other and to people around us who were, you know, in politics and we're like, that was chilling. It was very, very, very unnerving,\" Favreau's podcast co-host Tommy Vietor, who was also at the fundraiser, recalled.\n\nClooney added that \"every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private\" concurred with him that Biden was a liability not only for the presidency. \"We won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" if he stays at the top of the ticket, he added.\n\n\"Most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks. But the dam has broken. We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\" Clooney wrote, specifically addressing Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries and Rep. Nancy Pelosi to call on Biden to step aside.\n\nI've Seen Joe Biden Up Close. Nobody Can Deny His Decline.\n\nClooney also floated Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear and Vice President Kamala Harris as \"strong\" alternates who should be \"stepping forward to stand and tell us why they're best qualified to lead this country.\"\n\n\"Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\" Clooney suggested. \"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would.\"\n\nClooney closed the letter with praise for the president: \"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020. {"uri": "2024-07-417770254", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:48:10", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:48:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:44:16Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.bizpacreview.com/2024/07/10/george-clooney-admits-jig-is-up-biden-needs-to-step-down-says-his-struggles-apparent-at-fundraiser-1471393/", "title": "George Clooney admits jig is up, Biden needs to step down - says his struggles apparent at fundraiser", "body": "Famous actor George Clooney dropped a bombshell op-ed Wednesday calling on President Joe Biden to step out of the race.\n\nThe opinion piece, published in The New York Times, establishes Clooney as a \"lifelong Democrat\" who considers Biden \"a friend.\" It also quickly gets to the heart of the matter: President Biden's obvious cognitive decline and his ability to win in November.\n\n\"I'm a lifelong Democrat; I make no apologies for that. I'm proud of what my party represents and what it stands for. As part of my participation in the democratic process and in support of my chosen candidate, I have led some of the biggest fund-raisers in my party's history,\" he wrote. \"Barack Obama in 2012. Hillary Clinton in 2016. Joe Biden in 2020. Last month I co-hosted the single largest fund-raiser supporting any Democratic candidate ever, for President Biden's re-election. I say all of this only to express how much I believe in this process and how profound I think this moment is.\"\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him,\" the actor continued. \"Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\"\n\nHis love of the president isn't enough to keep him from stating the obvious.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney admits.\n\nThe actor blames fear of Trump for people choosing to ignore \"warning signs,\" but the debate was a problem even the most proficient spinmeister couldn't explain away.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nAt the end of the day, Clooney admitted a reality that many Democrats were forced to confront in the days following the debate: Biden can't win.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nHe then pointed to some popular names in leftist circles as potential replacements for POTUS.\n\n\"Let's hear from Wes Moore and Kamala Harris and Gretchen Whitmer and Gavin Newsom and Andy Beshear and J.B. Pritzker and others. Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nIn closing out his piece, Clooney called Joe Biden a \"hero\" who \"saved democracy in 2020,\" and wrote that the president needs to step down as a way to \"do it again in 2024.\"\n\nX users weighed in on the piece:\n\nWe have no tolerance for comments containing violence, racism, profanity, vulgarity, doxing, or discourteous behavior. {"uri": "2024-07-417797655", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "18:21:58", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T18:21:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T13:19:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2024/jul/10/george-clooney-calls-joe-biden-leave-race/", "title": "George Clooney calls on Biden to leave race in op-ed", "body": "Famed actor and lifelong Democrat George Clooney has abandoned President Biden as the party's presidential nominee, saying the \"dam has broken.\"\n\n\"I love Joe Biden. As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced,\" Mr. Clooney said in an op-ed published Wednesday in The New York Times.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time. None of us can,\" he said of Mr. Biden, 81.\n\nMr. Clooney, who played a big role in the record-breaking Biden fundraiser last month, said the man he saw then is different from the one of the past.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010,\" he wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe president and his campaign blamed his shaky performance at the Georgia debate last month on a cold and his recent travel abroad. His incoherence against a strong and clear Donald Trump shook Democrats, and since then a growing number of them -- in Congress and society -- have called on Mr. Biden to quit the race.\n\nSEE ALSO: Pelosi suggests Biden should rethink decision to stay in race\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" Mr. Clooney said.\n\nThe actor, 63, said the discussion \"is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate.\"\n\nHe added, \"This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private.\"\n\nHe argued that it's time for a new candidate, even if the process would be \"messy.\" He specifically mentioned Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Gavin Newsom of California, J.B. Pritzker of Illinois and Andy Beshear of Kentucky as possible replacements.\n\n\"We love to talk about how the Republican Party has ceded all power, and all of the traits that made it so formidable with Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush, to a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency, and yet most of our members of Congress are opting to wait and see if the dam breaks,\" Mr. Clooney said.\n\nSEE ALSO: ABC's Stephanopoulos caught saying Biden can't handle 4 more years\n\n\"But the dam has broken,\" he said. \"We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth.\"\n\nHe called Mr. Biden \"a hero [who] saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nMr. Biden has maintained that he is not dropping out despite growing calls for him to do so. {"uri": "8219150293", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:32:01", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:32:01Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:31:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.today.com/news/politics/-need-new-nominee-george-clooney-calls-biden-step-seeing-fundraiser-rcna161181", "title": "'We need a new nominee': George Clooney calls on Biden to step aside after seeing him at fundraiser", "body": "The actor and Democratic donor issued his call as prominent Democrats continue to step forward to question Biden's ability to win re-election against former President Donald Trump.\n\nActor George Clooney published a guest essay in The New York Times on Wednesday calling for Democratic leaders to coalesce behind a new presidential nominee amid mounting pressure from within the party for President Joe Biden to withdraw from the race.\n\nClooney, a major Democratic fundraiser, issued his call as prominent Democrats continue to step forward to question Biden's ability to win re-election against former President Donald Trump following the president's debate performance last month.\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010,\" Clooney wrote. \"He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nNBC News has reached out to the Biden campaign for comment.\n\nAmid Democratic handwringing in the days since the debate, Biden has defied calls to drop out and has dismissed polling broadly showing him trailing Trump in key states, although often within the margin of error.\n\nDemocratic donors, meanwhile, have been divided on how to chart a path forward on a nominee amid the dissension. Referring to the debate, Clooney, who called himself friend of Biden, wrote that party leaders \"need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign.\"\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" he added. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nDespite some defections, prominent Democrats in Congress have continued to voice support for Biden -- albeit waveringly -- Democratic primaries show he has the support of voters.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" he wrote.\n\n\"Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face Senate Democrats met on Tuesday to discuss the president's standing on the ticket but left largely stuck in limbo about the best next move.\n\nClooney opened the door to hear from other Democrats who could replace Biden, specifically listing Vice President Kamala Harris and Govs. Wes Moore, Gretchen Whitmer, Gavin Newsom, Andy Beshear and JB Pritzker. None of us can. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\n\nWas he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\n\nAnother blow to the \"cheap fake\" narrative - Clooney himself is confirming what we all saw at that fundraiser. {"uri": "8219169228", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-10", "time": "17:48:44", "dateTime": "2024-07-10T17:48:44Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-10T17:47:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7176470756530762, "url": "https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2024-07-10/george-clooney-joe-biden-step-aside-essay-2024-election", "title": "George Clooney calls on president to step aside: Aging Biden no longer the man he was", "body": "Even George Clooney -- a mega donor to President Biden's reelection campaign -- appears to have lost faith in the president's ability to win the 2024 election.\n\nThe two-time Oscar winner, lifelong Democrat and high-profile campaign donor has formally asked the 81-year-old commander in chief to step aside so that theparty can nominate a new candidate to take on former President Trump on the November ballot. Why? Because of Biden's \"fight against time,\" which Clooney characterized as the only battle that POTUS cannot win.\n\n\"None of us can,\" Clooney wrote Wednesday in an opinion piece for the New York Times titled \"I Love Joe Biden. But We Need a New Nominee.\" \"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe 'big F -- deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nDemocrats took in $30 million at that downtown L.A. fundraiser, setting a record for money generated by the party in a single night. In addition to Clooney, Julia Roberts and former President Obama headlined the event and Jimmy Kimmel acted as emcee.\n\nClooney wrote that Biden was a \"hero\" who had \"saved democracy\" in 2020 and called upon him to \"do it again in 2024.\" But, citing Biden's poor performance during CNN's debate last month, he joined a growing number of Hollywood backers, including those who previously wrote large checks to the campaign, feeling skittish about Biden's prospects despite the president's resolve to remain in the race.\n\nSome of those going public with their angst about Biden include \"Lost\" co-creator Damon Lindelof, Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings, Endeavor Chief Executive Ari Emanuel (brother of Rahm Emanuel, currently U.S. ambassador to Japan), media titan Barry Diller and Disney heir Abigail Disney.\n\nThe actor wondered if Biden was tired or suffering from a cold during his head-to-head with Trump. But he mostly took issue with the next-day narrative being spun by his party, arguing that Biden's nomination was not yet a sure thing ahead of the Democratic National Convention in August. (The GOP convention starts Monday.)\n\n\"[O]ur party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw. We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before,\" Clooney wrote. \"As Democrats, we collectively hold our breath or turn down the volume whenever we see the president, who we respect, walk off Air Force One or walk back to a mic to answer an unscripted question.\"\n\nClooney said it's \"fair\" to point these things out: \"This is about age. Nothing more.\"\n\nHe predicted the Democrats are \"not going to win in November with this president,\" nor would they win the House of Representatives or retain their majority in the Senate. He said this isn't just his opinion, but \"the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\n\"[T]he dam has broken. We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in November, or we can speak the truth,\" the \"Argo\" and \"Syriana\" Academy Award winner wrote. \"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information. We all think Republicans should abandon their nominee now that he's been convicted of 34 felonies.\"\n\nAs such, Clooney also criticized the presumptive Republican candidate and \"the revenge tour that Donald Trump calls a presidential campaign\" and called for the Democrats to seriously consider potential replacements. Who? Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, Vice President Kamala Harris, California Gov. Gavin Newsom, Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker, to name a few.\n\n\"Let's agree that the candidates not attack one another but, in the short time we have, focus on what will make this country soar. Then we could go into the Democratic convention next month and figure it out.\"\n\nIt would be \"messy,\" he said, but \"democracy is messy\" and a fresh contest would \"enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out.\"\n\nAlso on Wednesday morning, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) sent a rare public signal that suggested she is trying to nudge Biden to consider dropping out of the election, telling MSNBC that it's \"up to the president to decide if he is going to run\" and that \"we're all encouraging him to make that But by joining the whimpering chorus of Democrats calling for Biden to step aside after his disastrous debate performance, Clooney is taking on a noted grudge-holder in Joe Biden. Their relationship has been a little tense for over a couple months now.\n\nBefore May, Clooney was in lockstep with the Biden campaign, bundling millions for his effort in 2020 -- as he did for Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama (a friend) before him. But two months ago, Amal Clooney, the esteemed human rights lawyer who happens to be the actor's wife, sat on a review board that essentially greenlit the International Criminal Court prosecutor's decision to apply for a warrant to charge Benjamin Netanyahu and Israeli defense minister Yoav Gallant with war crimes over the invasion in Gaza. (A recent calculation by The Lancet puts the civilian death toll in Gaza at around 186,000 people, roughly 8 percent of the territory's population.) As the administration supplying Israel with its munitions to carry out the war, the Biden camp wasn't thrilled by this action, coming from an international body that the U.S. is not even a party to. White House officials called the decision an \"overreach,\" while Secretary of State Antony Blinken reportedly told Republican Senator Lindsay Graham he would \"welcome working with you\" on sanctioning ICC members.\n\nWith the prospect of his wife facing sanctions by the U.S. government, the Washington Post reported that Clooney texted Biden fundraiser and adviser Steve Ricchetti to express his concerns -- and hinted that his support of the president was not unconditional. It appears that the beef was partially resolved: In June, Clooney hosted a star-studded event for Biden's reelection\n\nthat raised $28 million. But after Oldgate, Clooney went in on just the issues. \"Is it fair to point these things out?\" Clooney asked in his op-ed. \"It has to be. This is about age. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nMr. Clooney, who last month hosted a $28 million fund-raiser in Hollywood for Mr. Biden that his campaign said was the largest ever for a Democratic candidate, is by far the highest-profile figure in the party to call for the president to end his campaign.\n\nHis guest essay was published just hours after Representative Nancy Pelosi, the former House speaker who remains influential in Democratic politics, suggested during a television interview that \"it's up to the president to decide if he is going to run.\"\n\nMr. Biden and his top aides have insisted that he is staying in the race until the end. On Monday, he told top donors that he was done addressing the debate -- though he brought it up again during a video call with Democratic mayors on Tuesday night.\n\nMr. Clooney wrote in The Times what scores of Democrats have been saying among themselves and in off-the-record conversations with reporters since the debate nearly two weeks ago -- that Mr. Biden is threatening not only his own chances in November but also those of fellow Democrats down the ballot.\n\n\"We are not going to win in November with this president,\" Mr. Clooney wrote. \"On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate. This isn't only my opinion; this is the opinion of every senator and congress member and governor that I've spoken with in private. Every single one, irrespective of what he or she is saying publicly.\"\n\nThe actor's defection comes after Mr. Biden had appeared to stanch some of the bleeding from within Democratic ranks. But the combination of Ms. Pelosi's suggestion that he had a decision to make and a famous and well-liked Democratic donor calling for him to quit is likely to set off a new round of unpleasant questions for Mr. Biden and his team.\n\nA representative for the Biden campaign referred to the president's letter to congressional Democrats on Monday, which reiterated that he would stay in the In the op-ed, Clooney said that the Biden he saw at a June 15 fundraising event for the president's reelection bid was the same Biden at the debate, referring to his mental difficulties. (RELATED: 'That Is The End Of It': Former Clinton Pollster Says Dems Would 'Commit Suicide' By Trying To Replace Biden)\n\n\"It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fund-raiser was not the Joe \"big F-ing deal\" Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate,\" Clooney wrote.\n\nDespite Clooney's admission that Biden appeared in decline at the June fundraiser, his op-ed was published on July 10.\n\n\"Was he tired? Yes. A cold? Maybe. But our party leaders need to stop telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw,\" Clooney added. \"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign. The George Stephanopoulos interview only reinforced what we saw the week before.\"\n\nDuring an interview with ABC News host George Stephanopoulos, a former Clinton administration official, Biden repeatedly dismissed polls showing him trailing Trump.\n\nBiden's age and mental fitness were issues dogging the president's campaign before the June 27 debate. On multiple occasions, Biden said he spoke with people who had died, including claiming Feb. 8 to have spoken with former German Chancellor Helmut Kohl about the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the Capitol, even though Kohl died in 2017.\n\n\"It is disingenuous, at best, to argue that Democrats have already spoken with their vote and therefore the nomination is settled and done, when we just received new and upsetting information,\" Clooney wrote. \"We all think Republicans should abandon their nominee now that he's been convicted of 34 felonies. That's new and upsetting information as well. Top Democrats -- Chuck Schumer, Hakeem Jeffries, Nancy Pelosi -- and senators, representatives and other candidates who face losing in November need to ask this president to voluntarily step aside.\"\n\nClooney said that the Democrats should turn to \"a very exciting bench\" that included Vice President Kamala Harris, Gov. Wes Moore of Maryland, Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, Gov. Andy Beshear of Kentucky, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California and Gov. J.B. Pritzker of Illinois. (RELATED: CNN Data Guru Says He Would 'Take A Roll Of The Dice' On Kamala Harris If He Were Dem Donor)\n\n\"Would it be messy? Yes. Democracy is messy. But would it enliven our party and wake up voters who, long before the June debate, had already checked out? It sure would,\" Clooney wrote. \"The short ramp to Election Day would be a benefit for us, not a danger. It would give us the chance to showcase the future without so much opposition research and negative campaigning that comes with these ridiculously long and expensive election seasons. This can be an exciting time for democracy, as we've just seen with the 200 or so French candidates who stepped aside and put their personal ambitions on hold to save their democracy from the far right.\"\n\n\"Joe Biden is a hero; he saved democracy in 2020,\" Clooney concluded. \"We need him to do it again in 2024.\"\n\nAll content created by the Daily Caller News Foundation, an independent and nonpartisan newswire service, is available without charge to any legitimate news publisher that can provide a large audience. As a Senator. As a Vice President and as President. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him. Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. It's devastating to say it, but the Joe Biden I was with three weeks ago at the fundraiser was not the Joe 'big F-ing deal' Biden of 2010. He wasn't even the Joe Biden of 2020. He was the same man we all witnessed at the debate.\"\n\nThe actor's blunt assessment comes at a critical time for Biden, who faces calls from more than a dozen Democratic lawmakers to bow out before it's too late. The editorial board of The New York Times has also urged Biden to step aside in two separate op-eds, saying he has \"continued to appear as a man in decline\" in the wake of the debate.\n\nOn Wednesday morning, the former House speaker Nancy Pelosi suggested that Biden could still change his mind about his re-election bid, as she refused to say whether she personally felt that the president should press on with his campaign.\n\n\"It's up to the president to [decide] if he's going to run. We're all encouraging him to make that decision because time is running short,\" she insisted.\n\nClooney, who is a longtime supporter of the Democratic Party, and whose wife, Amal, is a prominent human rights lawyer, spoke of his \"love\" for Biden as a senator, vice-president and president, praising the many \"battles\" the White House incumbent has won since taking office in January 2021.\n\nBut he suggested that Biden's halting, often confused, and generally low-energy appearance on an Atlanta debate stage opposite Trump was consistent with what he had observed when he hosted the president at the record-breaking fundraising event last month.\n\nIt was reported in June that Clooney's attendance at that Los Angeles fundraiser had been thrown into doubt after the actor directly called a top Biden aide to complain about the administration's rebuke over the issuing of an international arrest warrant for Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a case that his wife had backed. But the actor and the president have enjoyed a long and warm relationship, with Biden praising Clooney in 2022 for his \"deep empathy\".\n\nIn his op-ed, Clooney said Democratic Party leaders needed to stop \"telling us that 51 million people didn't see what we just saw\" after the 27 June debate.\n\n\"We're all so terrified by the prospect of a second Trump term that we've opted to ignore every warning sign,\" he said.\n\n\"Is it fair to point these things out? It has to be. This is about age. Nothing more. But also nothing that can be reversed. We are not going to win in November with this president. On top of that, we won't win the House, and we're going to lose the Senate,\" he continued, adding later that his opinion was shared by \"every senator and congress member and governor\" he had spoken to privately since the debate.\n\nThe actor and activist also compared the behaviour of Democrats to the way in which Republicans have ceded their party to Trump - \"a single person who seeks to hold on to the presidency\" - and chided members of Congress for \"opting to wait and see if the dam breaks\" rather than speaking up.\n\n\"We can put our heads in the sand and pray for a miracle in As a senator. As a vice president and as president. I consider him a friend, and I believe in him.\n\n\"Believe in his character. Believe in his morals. In the last four years, he's won many of the battles he's faced.\n\n\"But the one battle he cannot win is the fight against time.\"\n\nMr Biden's re-election effort has been under intense scrutiny since a disastrous performance in a debate with Trump last month.\n\nThe president, 81, has so far resisted calls to step down, including from some in his own party, saying he is \"firmly committed\" to staying in the race - and urging his fellow Democrats to put the debate to rest.\n\nBut Clooney wrote: \"This is about age. Nothing more. But We Need a New Nominee\", and concluded by saying Mr Biden was a \"hero\" for beating Mr Trump in the previous election.\n\n\"He saved democracy in 2020. We need him to do it again in 2024,\" Clooney said.\n\nEarlier, Mr Biden's re-election effort suffered a significant setback after one of his most prominent and long-time allies declined to endorse him.\n\nFormer House Speaker Nancy Pelosi stopped short of offering her support when asked if she backed his run for a second term in the White House.\n\nMs Pelosi was asked on the MSNBC show, Morning Joe, if he had her support to be the head of the Democratic ticket.\n\nShe replied: \"It's up to the president to decide if he is going to run.
